name: ABS
description: Returns the absolute value.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a constant, variable, or expression.

name: ADDRLONG
description: Returns the memory address of a variable on a 64-bit platform.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies a variable.

name: AIRY
description: Returns the value of a differential equation.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: ALLCOMB
description: Generates all combinations of the values of n variables taken k at a time in a minimal change order.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: specifies an integer variable that is assigned values from 1 to the number of combinations in a loop.

arguments.name: k
arguments.description: specifies an integer constant, variable, or expression between 1 and n, inclusive, that specifies the number of items in each combination.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies either all numeric variables or all character variables that have the same length. The values of these variables are permuted.

name: ALLPERM
description: Generates all permutations of the values of several variables in a minimal change order.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: specifies a variable with an integer value that ranges from 1 to the number of permutations.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies either all numeric variables or all character variables that have the same length. The values of these variables are permuted.

name: ANORM420
description: Returns a normalized string from an input string encoded in EBCDIC420.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies an input string that is encoded in EBCDIC420.

arguments.name: modifiers
arguments.description: are character constants, variables, or expressions that specify one or more modifiers. The following modifiers can be in uppercase or lowercase:

name: ANYALNUM
description: Searches a character string for an alphanumeric character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYALPHA
description: Searches a character string for an alphabetic character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYCNTRL
description: Searches a character string for a control character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYDIGIT
description: Searches a character string for a digit, and returns the first position at which the digit is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYFIRST
description: Searches a character string for a character that is valid as the first character in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYGRAPH
description: Searches a character string for a graphical character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYLOWER
description: Searches a character string for a lowercase letter, and returns the first position at which the letter is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYNAME
description: Searches a character string for a character that is valid in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYPRINT
description: Searches a character string for a printable character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYPUNCT
description: Searches a character string for a punctuation character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYSPACE
description: Searches a character string for a whitespace character (blank, horizontal or vertical tab, carriage return, line feed, and form feed), and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYUPPER
description: Searches a character string for an uppercase letter, and returns the first position at which the letter is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ANYXDIGIT
description: Searches a character string for a hexadecimal character that represents a digit, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: ARCOS
description: Returns the arccosine.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: ARCOSH
description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic cosine.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: ARSIN
description: Returns the arcsine.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: ARSINH
description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic sine.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: ARTANH
description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic tangent.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: ATAN
description: Returns the arc tangent.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: ATAN2
description: Returns the arc tangent of the x and y coordinates of a right triangle, in radians.

arguments.name: expression-1
arguments.description: specifies any valid expression that evaluates to a numeric value. expression-1 specifies the x coordinate of the end of the hypotenuse of a right triangle.

arguments.name: expression-2
arguments.description: specifies any valid expression that evaluates to a numeric value. expression-2 specifies the y coordinate of the end of the hypotenuse of a right triangle.

name: ATTRC
description: Returns the value of a character attribute for a SAS data set.

syntax.help: ATTRC (*data-set-id*,             CHARSET | COMPRESS | DATAREP | ENCODING | ENCRYPT | ENGINE | LABEL | LIB | MEM | MODE | MTYPE | SORTEDBY | SORTLVL | SORTSEQ | TYPE)

arguments.name: data-set-id
arguments.description: specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.

arguments.name: CHARSET
arguments.description: returns a value for the character set of the computer that created the data set.

arguments.name: COMPRESS
arguments.description: returns a value that specifies how a data set is compressed.

arguments.name: DATAREP
arguments.description: returns a value that indicates whether the data set is in a native format.

arguments.name: ENCODING
arguments.description: specifies the encoding of the data set.

arguments.name: ENCRYPT
arguments.description: returns 'YES' or 'NO' depending on whether the SAS data set is encrypted.

arguments.name: ENGINE
arguments.description: returns the name of the engine that is used to access the data set.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: returns the label assigned to the data set.

arguments.name: LIB
arguments.description: returns the libref of the SAS library in which the data set resides.

arguments.name: MEM
arguments.description: returns the SAS data set name.

arguments.name: MODE
arguments.description: returns the mode in which the SAS data set was opened, such as:

arguments.name: MTYPE
arguments.description: returns the SAS library member type.

arguments.name: SORTEDBY
arguments.description: returns an empty string if the data set is not sorted. Otherwise, it returns the names of the BY variables in the standard BY statement format.

arguments.name: SORTLVL
arguments.description: returns a value that indicates how a data set was sorted:

arguments.name: SORTSEQ
arguments.description: returns an empty string if the data set is sorted on the native computer or if the sort collating sequence is the default for the operating environment. Otherwise, it returns the name of the alternate collating sequence used to sort the file.

arguments.name: TYPE
arguments.description: returns the SAS data set type.

name: ATTRN
description: Returns the value of a numeric attribute for a SAS data set.

syntax.help: ATTRN (*data-set-id*,             ALTERPW | ANOBS | ANY | ARAND | ARWU | AUDIT | AUDIT_DATA | AUDIT_BEFORE | AUDIT_ERROR | CRDTE | ICONST | INDEX | ISINDEX | ISSUBSET | LRECL | LRID | MAXGEN | MAXRC | MODTE | NDEL | NEXTGEN | NLOBS | NLOBSF | NOBS | NVARS | PW | RADIX | READPW | REUSE | TAPE | WHSTMT | WRITEPW)

arguments.name: data-set-id
arguments.description: specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.

arguments.name: ALTERPW
arguments.description: specifies whether a password is required to alter the data set.

arguments.name: ANOBS
arguments.description: specifies whether the engine knows the number of observations.

arguments.name: ANY
arguments.description: specifies whether the data set has observations or variables.

arguments.name: ARAND
arguments.description: specifies whether the engine supports random access.

arguments.name: ARWU
arguments.description: specifies whether the engine can manipulate files.

arguments.name: AUDIT
arguments.description: specifies whether logging to an audit file is enabled.

arguments.name: AUDIT_DATA
arguments.description: specifies whether after-update record images are stored.

arguments.name: AUDIT_BEFORE
arguments.description: specifies whether before-update record images are stored.

arguments.name: AUDIT_ERROR
arguments.description: specifies whether unsuccessful after-update record images are stored.

arguments.name: CRDTE
arguments.description: specifies the date on which the data set was created. The value that is returned is the internal SAS datetime value for the creation date.

arguments.name: ICONST
arguments.description: returns information about the existence of integrity constraints for a SAS data set.

arguments.name: INDEX
arguments.description: specifies whether the data set supports indexing.

arguments.name: ISINDEX
arguments.description: specifies whether the data set is indexed.

arguments.name: ISSUBSET
arguments.description: specifies whether the data set is a subset.

arguments.name: LRECL
arguments.description: specifies the logical record length.

arguments.name: LRID
arguments.description: specifies the length of the record ID.

arguments.name: MAXGEN
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of generations.

arguments.name: MAXRC
arguments.description: specifies whether an application checks return codes.

arguments.name: MODTE
arguments.description: specifies the last date and time that the data set was modified. The value returned is the internal SAS datetime value.

arguments.name: NDEL
arguments.description: specifies the number of observations in the data set that are marked for deletion.

arguments.name: NEXTGEN
arguments.description: specifies the next generation number to generate.

arguments.name: NLOBS
arguments.description: specifies the number of logical observations (the observations that are not marked for deletion). An active WHERE clause does not affect this number.

arguments.name: NLOBSF
arguments.description: specifies the number of logical observations (the observations that are not marked for deletion) by forcing each observation to be read and by taking the FIRSTOBS system option, the OBS system option, and the WHERE clauses into account.

arguments.name: NOBS
arguments.description: specifies the number of physical observations (including the observations that are marked for deletion). An active WHERE clause does not affect this number.

arguments.name: NVARS
arguments.description: specifies the number of variables in the data set.

arguments.name: PW
arguments.description: specifies whether a password is required to access the data set.

arguments.name: RADIX
arguments.description: specifies whether access by observation number (radix addressability) is allowed.

arguments.name: READPW
arguments.description: specifies whether a password is required to read the data set.

arguments.name: REUSE
arguments.description: specifies whether new observations can be written to free space in compressed SAS data sets.

arguments.name: TAPE
arguments.description: specifies the status of the data set tape.

arguments.name: WHSTMT
arguments.description: specifies the active WHERE clauses.

arguments.name: WRITEPW
arguments.description: specifies whether a password is required to write to the data set.

name: AVG
description: Returns the arithmetic mean or average of all values in a column.

arguments.name: sql-expression
arguments.description: specifies any valid SQL expression. See .

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: (default) specifies that all nonmissing values returned by the SQL expression be used in the calculation.

arguments.name: DISTINCT
arguments.description: eliminates duplicate rows from the summary calculation.

name: BAND
description: Returns the bitwise logical AND of 32-bit integer values.

arguments.name: argument-1
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: argument-2
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: BASECHAR
description: Converts characters to base characters.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: data string that is converted.

arguments.name: instr
arguments.description: input data string.

arguments.name: Unicode
arguments.description: If one of the following Unicode character formats is specified, national characters are represented in the specified format:

name: BETA
description: Returns the value of the beta function.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: is the first shape parameter, where a>0.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: is the second shape parameter, where b>0.

name: BETAINV
description: Returns a quantile from the beta distribution.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is a numeric probability.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: is a numeric shape parameter.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: is a numeric shape parameter.

name: BHAMMING_32
description: Returns the bitwise Hamming distance between two 32-bit integer values.

arguments.name: argument-1
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: argument-2
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: BHAMMING_HEX
description: Returns the bitwise Hamming distance between two hexadecimal bit strings.

arguments.name: hex-string-1
arguments.description: specifies a character string containing hexadecimal characters. Leading and trailing blanks are ignored.

arguments.name: hex-string-2
arguments.description: specifies a character string containing hexadecimal characters. Leading and trailing blanks are ignored.

name: BLACKCLPRC
description: Calculates call prices for European options on futures, based on the Black model.

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the exercise price.

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: is a nonmissing value that specifies time to maturity, in years.

arguments.name: F
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the future price.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the annualized risk-free interest rate, continuously compounded.

arguments.name: sigma
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility (the square root of the variance of r).

name: BLACKPTPRC
description: Calculates put prices for European options on futures, based on the Black model.

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the exercise price.

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: is a nonmissing value that specifies time to maturity, in years.

arguments.name: F
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the future price.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the annualized risk-free interest rate, continuously compounded.

arguments.name: sigma
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility (the square root of the variance of r).

name: BLKSHCLPRC
description: Calculates call prices for European options on stocks, based on the Black-Scholes model.

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the exercise price.

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: is a nonmissing value that specifies the time to maturity, in years.

arguments.name: S
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the share price.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the annualized risk-free interest rate, continuously compounded.

arguments.name: sigma
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the underlying asset.

name: BLKSHPTPRC
description: Calculates put prices for European options on stocks, based on the Black-Scholes model.

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the exercise price.

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: is a nonmissing value that specifies the time to maturity, in years.

arguments.name: S
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the share price.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the annualized risk-free interest rate, continuously compounded.

arguments.name: sigma
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the underlying asset.

name: BLSHIFT
description: Returns the bitwise logical left shift of two 32-bit integer values.

arguments.name: argument-1
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: argument-2
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: BNOT
description: Returns the bitwise logical NOT of 32-bit integer values.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: BOR
description: Returns the bitwise logical OR of 32-bit integer values.

arguments.name: argument-1
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: argument-2
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: BRSHIFT
description: Returns the bitwise logical right shift of 32-bit integer values.

arguments.name: argument-1
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: argument-2
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: BTRIM
description: Removes blanks or specified characters from the beginning, the end, or both the beginning and end of a character string.

arguments.name: sql-expression
arguments.description: must resolve to a character string or character variable.

arguments.name: LEADING
arguments.description: removes the blanks or specified characters from the beginning of the character string.

arguments.name: TRAILING
arguments.description: removes the blanks or specified characters from the end of the character string.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: removes the blanks or specified characters from both the beginning and the end of the character string.

arguments.name: btrim-character
arguments.description: is a single character that is to be removed from the character string. The default character is a blank.

name: BXOR
description: Returns the bitwise logical EXCLUSIVE OR of two 32-bit integer values.

arguments.name: argument-1
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: argument-2
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: BYTE
description: Returns one character in the ASCII collating sequence.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies an integer that represents a specific ASCII character.

name: CAT
description: Does not remove leading or trailing blanks and returns a concatenated character string.

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, its value is converted to a character string by using the BESTw. format. In this case, leading blanks are removed and SAS does not write a note to the log.

name: CATQ
description: Concatenates character and numeric values by using a delimiter to separate items and by adding quotation marks to strings that contain the delimiter.

arguments.description: uses single quotation marks when CATQ adds quotation marks to a string.
uses double quotation marks when CATQ adds quotation marks to a string.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: adds quotation marks to all of the item arguments.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: adds quotation marks to item arguments that have leading or trailing blanks that are not removed by the S or T modifiers.

arguments.name: c
arguments.description: uses a comma as a delimiter.

arguments.name: d
arguments.description: indicates that you have specified the delimiter argument.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: uses a horizontal tab as the delimiter.

arguments.name: m
arguments.description: inserts a delimiter for every item argument after the first. If you do not use the M modifier, CATQ does not insert delimiters for item arguments that have a length of 0 after processing that is specified by other modifiers. The M modifier can cause delimiters to appear at the beginning or end of the result and can cause multiple consecutive delimiters to appear in the result.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: converts item arguments to name literals when the value does not conform to the usual syntactic conventions for a SAS name. A name literal is a string in quotation marks that is followed by the letter “n” without any intervening blanks. To use name literals in SAS statements, you must specify the SAS option VALIDVARNAME=ANY.

arguments.name: q
arguments.description: adds quotation marks to item arguments that already contain quotation marks.

arguments.name: s
arguments.description:
strips leading and trailing blanks from subsequently processed arguments:
• To strip leading and trailing blanks from the delimiter argument, specify the S modifier before the D modifier.
• To strip leading and trailing blanks from the item arguments but  not from the delimiter argument, specify the S modifier  after the D modifier.

arguments.name: t
arguments.description:
trims trailing blanks from subsequently processed arguments:
• To trim trailing blanks from the delimiter argument, specify the T modifier before the D modifier. 
• To trim trailing blanks from the item arguments but not from the delimiter argument, specify the T modifier after the D modifier.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: converts item arguments to hexadecimal literals when the value contains nonprintable characters.

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, its value is converted to a character string by using the BESTw. format. In this case, leading blanks are removed and SAS does not write a note to the log.

arguments.name: delimiter
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is used as a delimiter between concatenated strings. If you specify this argument, you must also specify the D modifier.

name: CATS
description: Removes leading and trailing blanks, and returns a concatenated character string.

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, its value is converted to a character string by using the BESTw. format. In this case, SAS does not write a note to the log.

name: CATT
description: Removes trailing blanks, and returns a concatenated character string.

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, its value is converted to a character string by using the BESTw. format. In this case, leading blanks are removed and SAS does not write a note to the log.

name: CATX
description: Removes leading and trailing blanks, inserts delimiters, and returns a concatenated character string.

arguments.name: delimiter
arguments.description: specifies a character string that is used as a delimiter between concatenated items.

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, its value is converted to a character string by using the BESTw. format. In this case, SAS does not write a note to the log. For more information, see .

name: CDF
description: Returns a value from a cumulative probability distribution.

arguments.name: distribution
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.

arguments.name: quantile
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value of the random variable.

arguments.name: parameter
arguments.description: are optional constants, variables, or expressions that specify the values of shape, location, or scale parameters that are appropriate for the specific distribution.

name: CEIL
description: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the argument, fuzzed to avoid unexpected floating-point results.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: CEILZ
description: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the argument, using zero fuzzing.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: CEXIST
description: Verifies the existence of a SAS catalog or SAS catalog entry.

arguments.name: entry
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies a SAS catalog, or the name of an entry in a catalog. If the entry value is a one- or two-level name, then it is assumed to be the name of a catalog. Use a three- or four-level name to test for the existence of an entry within a catalog.

arguments.name: 'U'
arguments.description: tests whether the catalog can be opened for updating.

name: CHAR
description: Returns a single character from a specified position in a character string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: is an integer that specifies the position of the character to be returned.

name: CHOOSEC
description: Returns a character value that represents the results of choosing from a list of arguments.

arguments.name: index-expression
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: selection
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. The value of this argument is returned by the CHOOSEC function.

name: CHOOSEN
description: Returns a numeric value that represents the results of choosing from a list of arguments.

arguments.name: index-expression
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: selection
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. The value of this argument is returned by the CHOOSEN function.

name: CINV
description: Returns a quantile from the chi-square distribution.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is a numeric probability.

arguments.name: df
arguments.description: is a numeric degrees of freedom parameter.

arguments.name: nc
arguments.description: is a numeric noncentrality parameter.

name: CLIBEXIST
description: Returns 0 when the specified caslib name is not found and 1 when the caslib is found.

arguments.name: session
arguments.description: a valid session name.

arguments.name: caslib
arguments.description: a valid caslib name.

arguments.name: uuid
arguments.description: specifies the uuid that you are trying to find. See for more information about uuid.

name: CLOSE
description: Closes a SAS data set.

arguments.name: data-set-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.

name: CMISS
description: Counts the number of missing arguments.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a constant, variable, or expression. Argument can be either a character value or a numeric value.

name: CNONCT
description: Returns the noncentrality parameter from a chi-square distribution.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: is a numeric random variable.

arguments.name: df
arguments.description: is a numeric degrees of freedom parameter.

arguments.name: probability
arguments.description: is a probability.

name: COALESCE
description: Returns the first nonmissing value from a list of columns.

arguments.name: column-name
arguments.description: See .

name: COALESCEC
description: Returns the first nonmissing value from a list of character arguments.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: COLLATE
description: Returns a character string in the ASCII collating sequence.

arguments.name: start-position
arguments.description: specifies the numeric position in the collating sequence of the first character to be returned.

arguments.name: end-position
arguments.description: specifies the numeric position in the collating sequence of the last character to be returned.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: specifies the number of characters in the collating sequence.

name: COMB
description: Computes the number of combinations of n elements taken r at a time.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is a nonnegative integer that represents the total number of elements from which the sample is chosen.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is a nonnegative integer that represents the number of chosen elements.

name: COMPARE
description: Returns the position of the leftmost character by which two strings differ, or returns 0 if there is no difference.

arguments.name: string-1
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: string-2
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character string that can modify the action of the COMPARE function.

name: COMPBL
description: Removes multiple blanks from a character string.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to compress.

name: COMPFUZZ
description: Performs a fuzzy comparison of two numeric values.

arguments.name: value-1
arguments.description: specifies the first of two numeric values to be compared.

arguments.name: value-2
arguments.description: specifies the second numeric value to be compared.

arguments.name: fuzz
arguments.description: is a nonnegative numeric value that specifies the relative threshold for comparisons. Values greater than or equal to 1 are treated as multiples of the machine precision.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: specifies the scale factor.

name: COMPFUZZ_MISS
description: Performs comparisons of missing numeric values and fuzzy comparisons of nonmissing numeric values.

arguments.name: value-1
arguments.description: specifies the first of two numeric values to be compared.

arguments.name: value-2
arguments.description: specifies the second numeric value to be compared.

arguments.name: fuzz
arguments.description: is a nonnegative numeric value that specifies the relative threshold for comparisons. Values greater than or equal to 1 are treated as multiples of the machine precision.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: specifies the scale factor.

name: COMPGED
description: Returns the generalized edit distance between two strings.

arguments.name: string-1
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: string-2
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: cutoff
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression. If the actual generalized edit distance is greater than the value of cutoff, the value that is returned is equal to the value of cutoff.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character string that can modify the action of the COMPGED function.

name: COMPLEV
description: Returns the Levenshtein edit distance between two strings.

arguments.name: string-1
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: string-2
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: cutoff
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. If the actual Levenshtein edit distance is greater than the value of cutoff, the value that is returned is equal to the value of cutoff.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character string that can modify the action of the COMPLEV function.

name: COMPOUND
description: Returns compound interest parameters.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: is numeric and specifies the initial amount.

arguments.name: f
arguments.description: is numeric and specifies the future amount (at the end of n periods).

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is numeric and specifies the periodic interest rate expressed as a fraction.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is an integer and specifies the number of compounding periods.

name: COMPRESS
description: Returns a character string with specified characters removed from the original string.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression from which specified characters are removed.

arguments.name: characters
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the COMPRESS function. Blanks are ignored.

name: COMPSRV_OVAL
description: Returns the original, possibly unsafe, value of an input parameter or global macro variable that is passed into the Compute server.

arguments.name: macro-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the input parameter or global macro variable (with no leading ampersands).

name: COMPSRV_UNQUOTE2
description: Unmasks matched pairs of quotation marks in an input parameter or global macro variable.

arguments.name: macro-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the input parameter or global macro variable (with no leading ampersands).

name: CONSTANT
description: Computes machine and mathematical constants.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the constant to be returned.

arguments.name: parameter
arguments.description: is an optional numeric parameter. Some of the constants specified in constant have an optional argument that alters the functionality of the CONSTANT function.

name: CONVX
description: Returns the convexity for an enumerated cash flow.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: specifies the effective per-period yield-to-maturity, expressed as a fraction.

arguments.name: f
arguments.description: specifies the frequency of cash flows per period.

arguments.name: c
arguments.description: specifies a list of cash flows.

name: CONVXP
description: Returns the convexity for a periodic cash flow stream such as a bond.

arguments.name: A
arguments.description: specifies the par value.

arguments.name: c
arguments.description: specifies the nominal per-period coupon rate, expressed as a fraction.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the number of coupons per period.

arguments.name: K
arguments.description: specifies the number of remaining coupons.

arguments.name: k0
arguments.description: specifies the time from the present date to the first coupon date, expressed in terms of the number of periods.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: specifies the nominal per-period yield-to-maturity, expressed as a fraction.

name: COS
description: Returns the cosine.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression and is expressed in radians. If the magnitude of argument is so great that mod(argument,pi) is accurate to less than about three decimal places, COS returns a missing value.

name: COSH
description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: COT
description: Returns the cotangent.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression and is expressed in radians.

name: COUNT
description: Returns the number of rows retrieved by a SELECT statement for a specified table.

arguments.description: returns a count of all rows in a table or grouping of rows, including rows that contain missing values.

arguments.name: sql-expression
arguments.description: specifies any valid SQL expression. See .

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: (default) specifies that all nonmissing values returned by sql-expression be counted.

arguments.name: DISTINCT
arguments.description: eliminates duplicate rows returned by sql-expression from the count.

name: COUNTC
description: Counts the number of characters that appear or do not appear in a list of characters.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which characters are counted.

arguments.name: character-list
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. COUNTC counts characters in this list, provided that you do not specify the V modifier in the modifier argument. If you specify the V modifier, all characters that are not in this list are counted. You can add more characters to the list by using other modifiers.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the COUNTC function. Blanks are ignored.

name: COUNTW
description: Counts the number of words in a character string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which words are counted.

arguments.name: character
arguments.description: specifies an optional character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. The characters in this list are the delimiters that separate words, provided that you do not use the K modifier in the modifier argument. If you specify the K modifier, all characters that are not in this list are delimiters. You can add more characters to the list by using other modifiers.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the COUNTW function.

name: CSC
description: Returns the cosecant.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression and is expressed in radians.

name: CSS
description: Returns the corrected sum of squares.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least one nonmissing argument is required. Otherwise, the function returns a missing value. If you have more than one argument, the argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.

name: CUMIPMT
description: Returns the cumulative interest paid on a loan between the start and end periods.

arguments.name: rate
arguments.description: specifies the interest rate per payment period.

arguments.name: number-of-periods
arguments.description: specifies the number of payment periods. Number-of-periods must be a positive integer value.

arguments.name: principal-amount
arguments.description: specifies the principal amount of the loan. If a missing value is specified, 0 is assumed.

arguments.name: start-period
arguments.description: specifies the start period for the calculation.

arguments.name: end-period
arguments.description: specifies the end period for the calculation.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: specifies whether the payments occur at the beginning or end of a period; 0 represents the end-of-period payments, and 1 represents the beginning-of-period payments. If type is omitted or if a missing value is specified, 0 is assumed.

name: CUMPRINC
description: Returns the cumulative principal paid on a loan between the start and end periods.

arguments.name: rate
arguments.description: specifies the interest rate per payment period.

arguments.name: number-of-periods
arguments.description: specifies the number of payment periods. Number-of-periods must be a positive integer value.

arguments.name: principal-amount
arguments.description: specifies the principal amount of the loan. If a missing value is specified, 0 is assumed.

arguments.name: start-period
arguments.description: specifies the start period for the calculation.

arguments.name: end-period
arguments.description: specifies the end period for the calculation.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: specifies whether the payments occur at the beginning or end of a period; 0 represents the end-of-period payments, and 1 represents the beginning-of-period payments. If type is omitted or if a missing value is specified, 0 is assumed.

name: CUROBS
description: Returns the observation number of the current observation.

arguments.name: data-set-id
arguments.description: is a numeric value that specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.

name: CV
description: Returns the coefficient of variation.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least two arguments are required. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.

name: DACCDB
description: Returns the accumulated declining balance depreciation.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, and specifies the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: is numeric, the lifetime of the asset.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is numeric, the rate of depreciation expressed as a decimal.

name: DACCDBSL
description: Returns the accumulated declining balance with conversion to a straight-line depreciation.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, and specifies the period for which the calculation is to be done.

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: is an integer, the lifetime of the asset.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is numeric, the rate of depreciation that is expressed as a fraction.

name: DACCSL
description: Returns the accumulated straight-line depreciation.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For fractional p, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: is numeric, the lifetime of the asset.

name: DACCSYD
description: Returns the accumulated sum-of-years-digits depreciation.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: is numeric, the lifetime of the asset.

name: DACCTAB
description: Returns the accumulated depreciation from specified tables.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.

arguments.name: t1,
arguments.description: are numeric, and are the fractions of depreciation for each time period with t1+t2+...tn less than or equal to ≤ 1.

name: DAIRY
description: Returns the derivative of the AIRY function.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: DATDIF
description: Returns the number of days between two dates after computing the difference between the dates according to specified day count conventions.

arguments.name: start-date
arguments.description: specifies a SAS date value that identifies the starting date.

arguments.name: end-date
arguments.description: specifies a SAS date value that identifies the ending date.
specifies a 30-day month and a 360-day year, regardless of the actual number of calendar days in a month or year.

arguments.name: 'ACT/ACT'
arguments.description: uses the actual number of days between dates. Each month is considered to have the actual number of calendar days in that month, and each year is considered to have the actual number of calendar days in that year.

arguments.name: 'ACT/360'
arguments.description: uses the actual number of calendar days in a particular month, and 360 days as the number of days in a year, regardless of the actual number of days in a year.

arguments.name: 'ACT/365'
arguments.description: uses the actual number of calendar days in a particular month, and 365 days as the number of days in a year, regardless of the actual number of days in a year.

name: DATE
description: Returns the current date as a SAS date value.

name: DATEJUL
description: Converts a Julian date to a SAS date value.

arguments.name: julian-date
arguments.description: specifies a SAS numeric expression that represents a Julian date. A Julian date in SAS is a date in the form yyddd or yyyyddd, where yy or yyyy is a two-digit or four-digit integer that represents the year and ddd is the number of the day of the year. The value of ddd must be between 1 and 365 (or 366 for a leap year).

name: DATEPART
description: Extracts the date from a SAS datetime value.

arguments.name: datetime
arguments.description: specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS datetime value.

name: DATETIME
description: Returns the current date and time of day as a SAS datetime value.

name: DAY
description: Returns the day of the month from a SAS date value.

arguments.name: date
arguments.description: specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS date value.

name: DCLOSE
description: Closes a directory that was opened by the DOPEN function.

arguments.name: directory-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.

name: DCREATE
description: Returns the complete pathname of a new, external directory.

arguments.name: directory-name
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the name of the directory to create. This value cannot include a pathname.

arguments.name: parent-directory
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that contains the complete pathname of the directory in which to create the new directory. If you do not supply a value for parent-directory, then the current directory is the parent directory.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: is numeric, the lifetime of the asset.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is numeric, the rate of depreciation that is expressed as a fraction.

name: DEPDBSL

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.

arguments.name: y

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is numeric, the rate of depreciation that is expressed as a fraction.

name: DEPSL

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For fractional p, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: is numeric, the lifetime of the asset.

name: DEPSYD
description: Returns the sum-of-years-digits depreciation.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: is numeric, the lifetime of the asset in number of depreciation periods.

name: DEPTAB
description: Returns the depreciation from specified tables.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.

arguments.name: t1,
arguments.description: are numeric, the fractions of depreciation for each time period with t1+t2+...tn less than or equal to ≤ 1.

name: DEQUOTE
description: Removes matching quotation marks from a character string that begins with a quotation mark, and deletes all characters to the right of the closing quotation mark.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: DEVIANCE
description: Returns the deviance based on a probability distribution.

arguments.name: distribution
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: shape-parameter
arguments.description: are one or more distribution-specific numeric parameters that characterize the shape of the distribution.

arguments.name: ε
arguments.description: is an optional numeric small value used for all of the distributions, except for the normal distribution.

name: DHMS
description: Returns a SAS datetime value from date, hour, minute, and second values.

arguments.name: date
arguments.description: specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS date value.

arguments.name: hour
arguments.description: is numeric.

arguments.name: minute
arguments.description: is numeric.

arguments.name: second
arguments.description: is numeric.

name: DIF
description: Returns differences between an argument and its nth lag.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the number of lags.

name: DIGAMMA
description: Returns the value of the digamma function.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: DIM
description: Returns the number of elements in an array.

arguments.name: array-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of an array that was previously defined in the same DATA step. This argument cannot be a constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: bound-n
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the dimension, in a multidimensional array, for which you want to know the number of elements. Use bound-n only when n is not specified.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the dimension, in a multidimensional array, for which you want to know the number of elements. If no n value is specified, the DIM function returns the number of elements in the first dimension of the array.

name: DINFO
description: Returns information about a directory.

arguments.name: directory-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.

arguments.name: information-item
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the information item to be retrieved. DINFO returns a blank if the value of the information-item argument is invalid. The information available varies according to the operating environment.

name: DIVIDE
description: Returns the result of a division that handles special missing values for ODS output.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents the numerator.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents the denominator.

name: DLGCDIR
description: Sets the working directory.

arguments.name: working_directory
arguments.description: specifies the working directory.

name: DNUM
description: Returns the number of members in a directory.

arguments.name: directory-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.

name: DOPEN
description: Opens a directory, and returns a directory identifier value.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the fileref assigned to the directory. In a DATA step, fileref can be a character expression, a character string, or a DATA step variable whose value contains the fileref. If the function is used in a DATA Step, then fileref must be enclosed in quotation marks. If the function is used in macro code, then fileref must not be enclosed in quotation marks. In macro code, fileref can be any expression.

name: DOPTNAME
description: Returns directory attribute information.

arguments.name: directory-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.

arguments.name: nval
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the sequence number of the information item.

name: DOPTNUM
description: Returns the number of information items that are available for a directory.

arguments.name: directory-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.

name: DOSUBL

name: DREAD

arguments.description: is a numeric value that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.

arguments.name: nval
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the sequence number of the member within the directory.

name: DROPNOTE

arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the data set or external file was opened, generally by the OPEN function or the FOPEN function.

arguments.name: note-id
arguments.description: is a numeric value that specifies the identifier that was assigned by the NOTE or FNOTE function.

name: DSNAME
description: Returns the SAS data set name that is associated with a data set identifier.

arguments.name: data-set-id

arguments.name: c

name: DURP

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: specifies the nominal per-period yield-to-maturity, expressed as a fraction.

name: EFFRATE
