arguments.name: compounding-interval
arguments.description: is a SAS interval. This value represents how often rate compounds.

arguments.name: rate
arguments.description: is numeric. Rate is a nominal annual interest rate (expressed as a percentage) that is compounded at each compounding interval.

name: ENCODCOMPAT
description: Verifies the transcoding compatibility between two encodings.

arguments.name: source1
arguments.description: a character string that represents an encoding.

arguments.name: source2
arguments.description: a character string that represents an encoding. This argument is optional.

name: ENCODISVALID
description: Verifies a valid encoding name.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: a character string that represents an encoding name.

name: ENVLEN
description: Returns the length of an environment variable.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a character variable that is the name of an operating system environment variable. Enclose argument in quotation marks.

name: ERF
description: Returns the value of the (normal) error function.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: ERFC
description: Returns the value of the complementary (normal) error function.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: EUCLID
description: Returns the Euclidean norm of the nonmissing arguments.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: EXIST
description: Verifies the existence of a SAS library member within a currently assigned SAS data library.

arguments.name: member-name
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the SAS library member. If member-name is blank or a null string, then EXIST uses the value of the _LAST_ system variable as the member name.

arguments.name: member-type
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the type of SAS library member. A few common member types include ACCESS, CATALOG, DATA, and VIEW. If you do not specify a member-type, then the member type DATA is assumed.

arguments.name: generation
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the generation number of the SAS data set whose existence you are checking. If member-type is not DATA, generation is ignored.

name: EXP
description: Returns the value of the exponential function.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. For more information, see .

name: EXPM1
description: Returns 1 less than the exponential function of the argument.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable, constant, or expression.

name: FACT
description: Computes a factorial.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: FAPPEND
description: Appends the current record to the end of an external file.

arguments.name: file-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

arguments.name: cc
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies a carriage-control character.

name: FCLOSE
description: Closes an external file, directory, or directory member.

arguments.name: file-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

name: FCOL
description: Returns the current column position in the File Data Buffer (FDB).

arguments.name: file-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

name: FCOPY
description: Copies records from one fileref to another fileref, and returns a value that indicates whether the records were successfully copied.

arguments.name: 'fileref-1'
arguments.description: specifies an existing fileref from which records are to be copied.

arguments.name: 'fileref-2'
arguments.description: specifies an existing fileref to which records are to be copied.

name: FDELETE
description: Deletes an external file or an empty directory.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the fileref that you assign to the external file or directory. You can assign filerefs by using the FILENAME statement, the FILENAME external file access function, or the FILENAME statement, FTP, Catalog, Hadoop, WebDAV, and ZIP access methods.

arguments.name: directory
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies an empty directory that you want to delete.

name: FETCH
description: Reads the next non-deleted observation from a SAS data set into the Data Set Data Vector (DDV).

arguments.name: data-set-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that is returned by the OPEN function.

arguments.name: 'NOSET'
arguments.description: prevents the automatic passing of SAS data set variable values to macro or DATA step variables even if the SET routine has been called.

name: FETCHOBS
description: Reads a specified observation from a SAS data set into the Data Set Data Vector (DDV).

arguments.name: data-set-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that is returned by the OPEN function.

arguments.name: observation-number
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of the observation to read. FETCHOBS treats the observation value as a relative observation number unless you specify the ABS option. The relative observation number might not coincide with the physical observation number on disk, because the function skips observations marked for deletion. When a WHERE clause is active, the function counts only observations that meet the WHERE condition.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that names one or more options, separated by blanks.

name: FEXIST
description: Verifies the existence of an external file that is associated with a fileref.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the fileref that is assigned to an external file.

name: FGET
description: Copies data from the File Data Buffer (FDB) into a variable.

arguments.name: file-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: in a DATA step, specifies a character variable to hold the data. In a macro, specifies a macro variable to hold the data. If variable is a macro variable and it does not exist, it is created.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: specifies the number of characters to retrieve from the FDB. If length is specified, only the specified number of characters is retrieved (or the number of characters remaining in the buffer if that number is less than length). If length is omitted, all characters in the FDB from the current column position to the next delimiter are returned. The default delimiter is a blank. The delimiter is not retrieved.

name: FILEEXIST
description: Verifies the existence of an external file by its physical name.

arguments.name: filename
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies a fully qualified physical filename of the external file in the operating environment.

name: FILENAME
description: Assigns or deassigns a fileref to an external file, directory, or output device.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies the fileref to assign to the external file. In a DATA step, fileref can be a character expression, a string enclosed in single quotation marks that specifies the fileref, or a DATA step variable whose value contains the fileref. In a macro (for example, in the %SYSFUNC function), fileref is the name of a macro variable (without an ampersand) whose value contains the fileref to assign to the external file. If the function is used within a DATA step, the fileref must be enclosed in single quotation marks. If the function is used in macro code, the fileref must not be enclosed in quotation marks.

arguments.name: filename
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the external file.

arguments.name: DISK
arguments.description: specifies that the device is a disk drive.

arguments.name: DUMMY
arguments.description: specifies that the output to the file is discarded.

arguments.name: FILESRVC
arguments.description: specifies an access method that enables you to store and retrieve user content using the SAS Viya service.

arguments.name: GTERM
arguments.description: indicates that the output device type is a graphics device that is receiving graphics data.

arguments.name: PIPE
arguments.description: specifies an unnamed pipe.

arguments.name: PLOTTER
arguments.description: specifies an unbuffered graphics output device.

arguments.name: PRINTER
arguments.description: specifies a printer or printer spool file.

arguments.name: TAPE
arguments.description: specifies a tape drive.

arguments.name: TEMP
arguments.description: creates a temporary file that exists only as long as the filename is assigned. The temporary file can be accessed only through the logical name and is available only while the logical name exists.

arguments.name: TERMINAL
arguments.description: specifies the user's personal computer.

arguments.name: UPRINTER
arguments.description: specifies a Universal Printing printer definition name.

arguments.name: 'host-options'
arguments.description: specifies host-specific details such as file attributes and processing attributes.

arguments.name: directory-reference
arguments.description: specifies the fileref that was assigned to the directory or partitioned data set in which the external file resides.

name: FILEREF
description: Verifies whether a fileref has been assigned for the current SAS session.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the fileref to be validated.

name: FINANCE
description: Computes financial calculations such as depreciation, maturation, accrued interest, net present value, periodic savings, and internal rates of return.

arguments.name: string-identifier
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. Valid values for string-identifier are listed in the following table.

arguments.name: basis
arguments.description: is an optional parameter that specifies a character or numeric value that indicates the type of day count basis to use.

arguments.name: interest-rates
arguments.description: specifies rates that are provided as numeric values and not as percentages.

arguments.name: dates
arguments.description: specifies that all dates in the financial functions are SAS dates.

arguments.name: sign-of-cash-values
arguments.description: for all the arguments, specifies that the cash that you pay out, such as deposits to savings or other withdrawals, is represented by negative numbers. It also specifies that the cash that you receive, such as dividend checks and other deposits, is represented by positive numbers.

name: FIND
description: Searches for a specific substring of characters within a character string.

syntax.help:
FIND (string, substring <, modifier(s)> <, start-position>)
FIND (string, substring <, start-position> <, modifier(s)>)

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is searched for substrings.

arguments.name: substring
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the substring of characters to search for in string.

arguments.name: i
arguments.description: ignores character case during the search. If this modifier is not specified, FIND searches only for character substrings with the same case as the characters in substring.

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: trims trailing blanks from string and substring.

arguments.name: start-position
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction of the search.

name: FINDC
description: Searches a string for any character in a list of characters.

syntax.help:
FINDC (string <, character-list>) 
FINDC (string, character-list <, modifier(s)>)
FINDC (string, character-list, modifier(s) <, start-position>)
FINDC (string, character-list, <start-position>, <modifier(s)>)

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to be searched.

arguments.name: character-list
arguments.description: is a constant, variable, or character expression that initializes a list of characters. FINDC searches for the characters in this list provided that you do not specify the K modifier in the modifier argument. If you specify the K modifier, FINDC searches for all characters that are not in this list of characters. You can add more characters to the list by using other modifiers.

arguments.name: blank
arguments.description: is ignored.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: adds alphabetic characters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: searches from right to left, instead of from left to right, of the start-position argument.

arguments.name: c
arguments.description: adds control characters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: d
arguments.description: adds digits to the list of characters.

arguments.name: f
arguments.description: adds an underscore and English letters (that is, the characters that can begin a SAS variable name using VALIDVARNAME=V7) to the list of characters.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: adds graphic characters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: adds a horizontal tab to the list of characters.

arguments.name: i
arguments.description: ignores character case during the search.

arguments.name: k
arguments.description: searches for any character that does not appear in the list of characters. If you do not specify this modifier, then FINDC searches for any character that appears in the list of characters. This modifier has the same functionality as the v or V modifier.

arguments.name: l
arguments.description: adds lowercase letters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: adds digits, an underscore, and English letters (that is, the characters that can appear in a SAS variable name using VALIDVARNAME=V7) to the list of characters.

arguments.name: o
arguments.description: processes the charlist and the modifier arguments only once, rather than every time the FINDC function is called. Using the O modifier in the DATA step (excluding WHERE clauses), or in the SQL procedure can make FINDC run faster when you call it in a loop where the character-list and the modifier arguments do not change.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: adds punctuation marks to the list of characters.

arguments.name: s
arguments.description: adds space characters to the list of characters (blank, horizontal tab, vertical tab, carriage return, line feed, and form feed).

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: trims trailing blanks from the string and character-list arguments.

arguments.name: u
arguments.description: adds uppercase letters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: searches for any character that does not appear in the list of characters. If you do not specify this modifier, then FINDC searches for any character that appears in the list of characters. This modifier has the same functionality as the k or K modifier.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: adds printable characters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: adds hexadecimal characters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: start-position
arguments.description: is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression having an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: FINDW
description: Returns the character position of a word in a string, or returns the number of the word in a string.

syntax.help:
FINDW (string, word <, character(s)>)
FINDW (string, word, character(s), modifier(s) <, start-position>)
FINDW (string, word, character(s), start-position <, modifier(s)>)
FINDW (string, word, start-position <, character(s) <, modifier(s)>>)

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to be searched.

arguments.name: word
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the word to search for in string.

arguments.name: character
arguments.description: is an optional character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters.

arguments.name: start-position
arguments.description: is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should begin and the direction in which to search.

arguments.name: blank
arguments.description: is ignored.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: adds alphabetic characters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: scans from right to left instead of from left to right, regardless of the sign of the start-position argument.

arguments.name: c
arguments.description: adds control characters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: d
arguments.description: adds digits to the list of characters.

arguments.name: e
arguments.description: counts the words that are scanned until the specified word is found, instead of determining the character position of the specified word in the string. Fragments of a word are not counted.

arguments.name: f
arguments.description: adds an underscore and English letters (that is, the characters that can begin a SAS variable name using VALIDVARNAME=V7) to the list of characters.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: adds graphic characters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: adds a horizontal tab to the list of characters.

arguments.name: i
arguments.description: ignores the case of the characters.

arguments.name: k
arguments.description: causes all characters that are not in the list of characters to be treated as delimiters. If K is not specified, then all characters that are in the list of characters are treated as delimiters.

arguments.name: l
arguments.description: adds lowercase letters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: m
arguments.description: specifies that multiple consecutive delimiters, and delimiters at the beginning or end of the string argument, refer to words that have a length of zero.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: adds digits, an underscore, and English letters (that is, the characters that can appear after the first character in a SAS variable name using VALIDVARNAME=V7) to the list of characters.

arguments.name: o
arguments.description: processes the character and modifier arguments only once, rather than every time the FINDW function is called. Using the O modifier in the DATA step (excluding WHERE clauses), or in the SQL procedure, can make FINDW run faster when you call it in a loop where the character and modifier arguments do not change.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: adds punctuation marks to the list of characters.

arguments.name: q
arguments.description: ignores delimiters that are inside substrings that are enclosed in quotation marks. If the value of the string argument contains unmatched quotation marks, then scanning from left to right produces different words than scanning from right to left.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: removes leading and trailing delimiters from the word argument.

arguments.name: s
arguments.description: adds space characters (blank, horizontal tab, vertical tab, carriage return, line feed, and form feed) to the list of characters.

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: trims trailing blanks from the string, word, and character arguments.

arguments.name: u
arguments.description: adds uppercase letters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: adds printable characters to the list of characters.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: adds hexadecimal characters to the list of characters.

name: FINFO
description: Returns the value of a file information item.

arguments.name: file-id
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

arguments.name: information-item
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the name of the file information item to be retrieved. • Create Time: ddmmmyyyy:hh:mm:ss • Last Modified: ddmmmyyyy:hh:mm:ss • Filename • File size (bytes) • RECFM • LRECL

name: FINV

name: FIPNAMEL

name: FIPSTATE

arguments.name: expression

name: FIRST
description: Returns the first character in a character string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character string.

name: FLOOR
description: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the argument, fuzzed to avoid unexpected floating-point results.

arguments.name: argument

name: FLOORZ
description: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the argument, using zero fuzzing.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: FMTINFO
description: Retrieves information about a format or informat.

arguments.name: fmtname
arguments.description: specifies the format or informat name.

arguments.name: CAT
arguments.description:
specifies the category:
• BIDI Text Handling
• Character
• Currency Conversion
• Date and Time 
• DBCS
• Hebrew Text Handling 
• ISO 8601
• Numeric

arguments.name: TYPE
arguments.description:
specifies the type of language element:

• format

arguments.name: DESC
arguments.description: specifies a short description of the format or informat.

arguments.name: MIND
arguments.description: specifies the minimum decimal value of the format or informat.

arguments.name: MAXD
arguments.description: specifies the maximum decimal value of the format or informat.

arguments.name: DEFD
arguments.description: specifies the default decimal value of the format or informat.

arguments.name: MINW
arguments.description: specifies the minimum width value of the format or informat.

arguments.name: MAXW
arguments.description: specifies the maximum width value of the format or informat.

arguments.name: DEFW
arguments.description: specifies the default width value of the format or informat.

name: FNONCT
description: Returns the value of the noncentrality parameter of an F distribution.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: is a numeric random variable.

arguments.name: ndf
arguments.description: is a numeric numerator degree of freedom parameter.

arguments.name: ddf
arguments.description: is a numeric denominator degree of freedom parameter.

arguments.name: probability
arguments.description: is a probability.

name: FNOTE
description: Identifies the last record that was read, and returns a value that the FPOINT function can use.

arguments.name: file-id
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

name: FOPEN
description: Opens an external file and returns a file identifier value.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the fileref assigned to the external file.

arguments.name: open-mode
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the type of access to the file:

arguments.name: record-length
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the logical record length of the file. To use the existing record length for the file, specify a length of 0, or do not provide a value here.

arguments.name: record-format
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the record format of the file. To use the existing record format, do not specify a value here. Valid values are:

name: FOPTNAME

arguments.name: file-id

arguments.name: nval
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of the information item.

name: FOPTNUM
description: Returns the number of information items, such as filename or record length, that are available for an external file.

arguments.name: file-id
arguments.description: is the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

name: FPOINT
description: Positions the read pointer on the next record to be read.

name: FPOS

arguments.name: nval

name: FPUT
description: Moves data to the File Data Buffer (FDB) of an external file, starting at the FDB's current column position.

name: FREAD
description: Reads a record from an external file into the File Data Buffer (FDB).

name: FREWIND

arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

name: FRLEN

arguments.name: file-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

name: FSEP
description: Sets the token delimiters for the FGET function.

arguments.name: file-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

arguments.name: character
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one or more delimiters that separate items in the File Data Buffer (FDB). Each character listed is a delimiter. That is, if character is #@, either # or @ can separate items. Multiple consecutive delimiters, such as @#@, are treated as a single delimiter.

arguments.name: 'x'

arguments.name: 'X'
arguments.description: specifies that the character delimiter is a hexadecimal value.

name: FUZZ
description: Returns the nearest integer if the argument is within 1E−12 of that integer.

arguments.name: t

arguments.name: S

arguments.name: Rd

name: GEODIST

arguments.name: latitude-2
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the coordinate of a given position north or south of the equator. Coordinates that are located north of the equator have positive values; coordinates that are located south of the equator have negative values.

arguments.name: longitude-1
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the coordinate of a given position east or west of the prime meridian, which runs through Greenwich, England. Coordinates that are located east of the prime meridian have positive values; coordinates that are located west of the prime meridian have negative values.

arguments.name: longitude-2

Coordinates that are located east of the prime meridian have positive values; coordinates that are located west of the prime meridian have negative values.

arguments.name: D

arguments.name: R

name: GEOMEANZ

name: GITFN_PULL
description: Pulls changes from the remote repository into the local repository.

syntax.help:
Form 1: 
GITFN_PULL ( directory)
Form 2: 
GITFN_PULL ( directory, user, password)
Form 3: 
GITFN_PULL ( directory, ssh-user, ssh-password,ssh-public-key, ssh-private-key)

arguments.name: directory
arguments.description: specifies the local repository that you want to pull changes to from the remote repository.

arguments.name: user
arguments.description: specifies the Git user name credential for the remote repository.

arguments.name: password
arguments.description: specifies the Git password credential for the remote repository.

arguments.name: ssh-user
arguments.description: specifies the SSH user name for the remote repository.

arguments.name: ssh-password
arguments.description: specifies the password for your SSH keys.

arguments.name: ssh-public-key
arguments.description: specifies the pathname for the public ssh key file.

arguments.name: ssh-private-key
arguments.description: specifies the pathname for the private ssh key file.

arguments.name: ssh-user

arguments.name: ssh-public-key

arguments.name: ssh-private-key

name: GITFN_STATUS_GET

arguments.description: specifies the nth status object to retrieve attributes from.

arguments.name: directory
arguments.description: specifies the path of a cloned Git repository on the SAS server.

arguments.name: attribute
arguments.description: specifies the attribute of the status object to return. Valid attributes are "PATH", "STATUS", or "STAGED". Only one attribute can be specified. If a non-valid attribute is specified, an error occurs.

arguments.name: attribute-store
arguments.description: specifies a character variable that stores the returned attribute.

name: GITFN_VERSION

name: GIT_CLONE
description: Clones a Git repository into a directory on the SAS server.

syntax.help:
Form 1: 
GIT_CLONE  ('uri', 'directory '<,                         'user', 'password |                             personal-access-token'>
                <, '',                         '',                         'SSL-CA-certificate-path'>)
Form 2: 
GIT_CLONE  ('uri', 'directory', 'user',                     'password', 'ssh-public-key-path', 'ssh-private-key-path')
Form 3: 
GIT_CLONE ('uri',                 'directory',                 '',                 '',                 '',                 '',                 'SSL-CA-certificate-path',                 kerberos)
Form 4: 
GIT_CLONE ('uri',                 'directory',                 '',                 '',                 '',                 '',                 '',                 2,                 auth-domain-ID)

arguments.name: 'uri'
arguments.description: specifies the Git repository URI. The URI can be either HTTPS or SSH.

arguments.name: 'directory'
arguments.description: specifies a target directory on the SAS server to clone the repository to.

arguments.name: 'user'
arguments.description: specifies the user name for a secure repository.

arguments.name: 'password
arguments.description: specifies the password for a secure repository
specifies an empty string.

arguments.name: 'SSL-CA-certificate-path'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname for the SSL certificate. If you do not require an SSL certificate, specify empty quotation marks ('' or "") for this argument.

arguments.name: 'user'
arguments.description: specifies the user name for a secure repository.

arguments.name: 'password'
arguments.description: specifies the password for a secure repository.

arguments.name: 'ssh-public-key-path'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname for the public SSH key file.

arguments.name: 'ssh-private-key-path'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname for the private SSH key file.
specifies an empty string.

arguments.name: authentication-option
arguments.description: specifies to the authentication method. Specify 1 to use Kerberos authentication. Specify 2 to use the credentials service. Specify 0, or leave the argument blank to not use Kerberos or the credentials service authentication.

arguments.name: 'auth-domain-ID'
arguments.description: specifies the domain ID to retrieve the credentials.

arguments.name: 'update-reference'

arguments.name: 'author-name'

arguments.name: 'author-email'
arguments.description: specifies the email of the commit author.

arguments.name: 'commit-message'

arguments.name: 'second-parent-commit-ID'

arguments.name: file

name: GIT_FETCH
description: Fetches updates from the remote repository.

arguments.name: 'directory'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname of a local Git repository on the SAS server.

arguments.name: 'user'
arguments.description: specifies the user name for a secure repository.

arguments.name: 'password'
arguments.description: specifies the password for a secure repository.

arguments.name: 'ssh-public-key-path'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname for the public SSH key file.

arguments.name: 'ssh-private-key-path'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname for the private SSH key file.

arguments.name: 'target-branch'
arguments.description: specifies the name of the remote repository target branch to fetch. If the target branch is not specified, all changes are fetched from the remote repository.

arguments.name: 'SSL-CA-certificate-path'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname for the SSL certificate. If you do not require an SSL certificate, specify empty quotation marks ('' or "") for this argument.

arguments.name: authentication-option
arguments.description: specifies to the authentication method. Specify 1 to use Kerberos authentication. Specify 2 to use the credentials service. Specify 0, or leave the argument blank to not use Kerberos or the credentials service authentication.

arguments.name: 'auth-domain-ID'
arguments.description: specifies the domain ID to retrieve the credentials.

name: GIT_INDEX_ADD
description: Stages 1 to n number of files to commit to the local repository.

arguments.name: 'file'
arguments.description: specifies the local pathname of a file to stage in the local repository.

arguments.name: 'status'
arguments.description: specifies the status of a file to stage in the local repository. The status can be "New", "Modified", or "Deleted".

name: GIT_INDEX_REMOVE
description: Unstages 1 to n number of files to commit to the local repository.

arguments.name: 'directory'

name: GIT_INIT_REPO
description: Initializes a new local Git repository.

arguments.name: 'directory'
arguments.description: specifies a target directory on the SAS server to create a local repository.

arguments.name: 'default-branch-name'
arguments.description: specifies the default branch name for the repository.

arguments.name: 'remote-URL'
arguments.description: specifies the remote repository URL to be configured for the local repository. If no remote URL is set, the repository is a local-only repository. Local-only repositories return errors if you use the GIT_PUSH, GIT_PULL, or GIT_FETCH function.

name: GIT_PULL

name: GIT_REBASE
description: Rebases your current branch to a specified commit ID.

arguments.name: 'directory'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname of a local Git repository on the SAS server.

arguments.name: 'current-branch-commit-ID'
arguments.description: specifies the commit ID of the current branch.

arguments.name: 'rebase-commit-ID'
arguments.description: specifies the commit ID to rebase your current branch on to.

arguments.name: 'name'
arguments.description: specifies the name of the person who is performing the rebase.

arguments.name: 'email'
arguments.description: specifies the email of the person who is performing the rebase.

name: GIT_REBASE_OP
description: Used to execute rebase operations when a conflict occurs.

arguments.name: 'directory'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname of a local Git repository on the SAS server.

arguments.name: ABORT
arguments.description: cancels the rebase and resets the repository to its previous state before the rebase.

arguments.name: SKIP
arguments.description: skips the conflicting commit that stopped the rebase and continues the rebase.

arguments.name: CONTINUE
arguments.description: continues the rebase after the conflicts have been resolved.

arguments.name: FINISH
arguments.description: finishes the rebase at the current location.

arguments.name: 'branch-name'
arguments.description: specifies the name of the branch that was checked out when the rebase started.

arguments.name: 'name'
arguments.description: specifies the name of the person who is performing the rebase.

arguments.name: 'email'
arguments.description: specifies the email of the person who is performing the rebase.

name: GIT_REF_FREE
description: Clears the reference objects that are associated with the local repository.

arguments.name: 'directory'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname of a local Git repository on the SAS server.

name: GIT_REF_GET
description: Returns the specified attribute of a reference object in the local repository.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the nth reference object to retrieve attributes from.

arguments.name: 'directory'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname of a local Git repository on the SAS server.

arguments.name: repo_path
arguments.description: returns the repository path.

arguments.name: reference
arguments.description: returns the relative path to the reference file within the local repository. The return value always beings with "refs" and ends with the name of the reference.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: returns the commit ID that is associated with the refence.

arguments.name: attribute-out
arguments.description: specifies a character variable that stores the returned attribute.

name: GIT_REF_LIST
description: Returns the list of reference objects that are associated with the local repository.

arguments.name: 'directory'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname of a local Git repository on the SAS server.

arguments.name: create-data-set
arguments.description: specifies to return the reference list in a data structure stored in memory. The data structure is accessed using the GIT_REF_GET function, and the data structure must be cleared using the GIT_REF_FREE function.

name: GIT_RESET
description: Resets the local repository to a specified commit.

arguments.description: specifies the pathname of a cloned Git repository on the SAS server.

arguments.name: 'commit-ID'
arguments.description: specifies the commit ID to reset the local repository to.

arguments.name: 'reset_type'
arguments.description: specifies the type of reset.

name: GIT_RESET_FILE

name: GIT_STASH

name: GIT_STASH_APPLY

arguments.name: stash-index
arguments.description: specifies the index of the stash to apply. If no stash index is specified, the GIT_STASH_APPLY function defaults to the top of the stash stack that corresponds to the index position stash-index=0.

name: GIT_STASH_DROP
description: Drops the contents of the stash stack at the specified index.

arguments.name: stash-index
arguments.description: specifies the index of the stash to drop. If no stash index is specified, the GIT_STASH_DROP function defaults to the top of the stash stack that corresponds to the index position stash-index=0.

name: GIT_STASH_POP
description: Applies the changes that are stored in the stash, and then drops the contents of the stash.

name: GIT_VERSION

name: GRAYCODE
description: Generates all subsets of n items in a minimal change order.

syntax.help:
GRAYCODE (k, numeric-variable-1, ..., numeric-variable-n)
GRAYCODE (k, character-variable <, n <, in-out>>)

arguments.name: k
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable. Initialize k to either of the following values before executing the GRAYCODE function: • a negative number to cause GRAYCODE to initialize the subset to be empty • the number of items in the initial set indicated by numeric-variable-1 through numeric-variable-n, or character-variable, which must be an integer value between 0 and n inclusive

arguments.name: numeric-variable
arguments.description: specifies numeric variables that have values of 0 or 1 which are updated when GRAYCODE is executed. A value of 1 for numeric-variable-j indicates that the jth item is in the subset. A value of 0 for numeric-variable-j indicates that the jth item is not in the subset.

arguments.name: character-variable
arguments.description: specifies a character variable that has a length of at least n characters. The first n characters indicate which items are in the subset. By default, an "I" in the jth position indicates that the jth item is in the subset, and an "O" in the jth position indicates that the jth item is out of the subset. You can change the two characters by specifying the in-out argument.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. By default, n is the length of character-variable.

arguments.name: in-out
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. The default value is "IO." The first character is used to indicate that an item is in the subset. The second character is used to indicate that an item is out of the subset.

specifies the optional question mark (?) and double question mark (??) modifiers that suppress the printing of notes and input lines when invalid data values are read. The ? modifier suppresses the invalid data message. The ?? modifier suppresses the invalid data message and prevents the automatic variable _ERROR_ from being set to 1 when invalid data is read.

arguments.name: informat.
arguments.description: is the SAS informat that you want to apply to the source. This argument must be the name of an informat followed by a period. The argument cannot be a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: end-date

arguments.description: specifies that continuous time is measured. The interval is shifted based on the starting date.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: specifies that discrete time is measured. The discrete method counts interval boundaries (for example, end of month).

arguments.description: specifies a negative, positive, or zero integer that represents the number of date, time, or datetime intervals. Increment is the number of intervals to shift the value of start-from.

arguments.description: specifies the name of the basic interval type. For example, YEAR specifies yearly intervals.

arguments.name: multiple
arguments.description: specifies an optional multiplier that sets the interval equal to a multiple of the period of the basic interval type. For example, the interval YEAR2 consists of two-year, or biennial, periods.

arguments.name: shift-index
arguments.description: specifies an optional shift index that shifts the interval to start at a specified subperiod starting point. For example, YEAR.3 specifies yearly periods shifted to start on the first of March of each calendar year and to end in February of the following year.

name: INTTEST
description: Returns 1 if a time interval is valid, and returns 0 if a time interval is invalid.

arguments.name: interval
arguments.description: specifies the name of the basic interval type. For example, YEAR specifies yearly intervals.

arguments.name: multiple
arguments.description: specifies an optional multiplier that sets the interval equal to a multiple of the period of the basic interval type. For example, YEAR2 consists of two-year, or biennial, periods.

arguments.name: shift-index
arguments.description: specifies an optional shift index that shifts the interval to start at a specified subperiod starting point. For example, YEAR.3 specifies yearly periods that are shifted to start on the first of March of each calendar year and to end in February of the following year.

name: INTZ
description: Returns the integer portion of the argument, using zero fuzzing.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: INVCDF
description: Computes the quantile from any distribution for which you have defined a cumulative distribution function (CDF).

arguments.name: quantile
arguments.description: specifies the quantile that is returned from the INVCDF function.

arguments.name: 'CDF-function-name'
arguments.description: specifies the name of the CDF function. Enclose CDF-function-name in quotation marks.

arguments.name: initial-value
arguments.description: specifies the initial guess for the quantile at which the inversion process starts. This is useful when you have an idea of the approximate value for quantile (for example, from the empirical estimate of the CDF).

arguments.name: desired-accuracy
arguments.description: specifies the desired relative accuracy of the quantile. You can specify any value in the range (0,0.1). If you specify a smaller value, the result is a more accurate estimate of the quantile, but it might take longer to invert the CDF.

arguments.name: domain-type
arguments.description: specifies the domain for the CDF function. A missing value or a value of 0 indicates a nonnegative support, that is [0,∞). Any other value indicates a support over the entire real line, that is (-∞,∞).

indicates success. If negative, then the absolute value is the number of times the CDF function was evaluated in order to compute the quantile. A larger absolute value indicates longer convergence time.
indicates that the quantile could not be computed.

arguments.name: cumulative-probability
arguments.description: specifies the cumulative probability value for which the quantile is desired.

arguments.name: parameter
arguments.description: specifies the parameters of the distribution at which the quantile is desired. You must specify exactly the same number of parameters as required by the specified CDF function, and they should appear exactly in the same order as required by the specified CDF function.

name: IORCMSG
description: Returns a formatted error message for _IORC_.

name: IPMT
description: Returns the interest payment for a given period for a constant payment loan or the periodic savings for a future balance.

arguments.name: rate
arguments.description: specifies the interest rate per payment period.

arguments.name: period
arguments.description: specifies the payment period for which the interest payment is computed.

arguments.name: number-of-periods
arguments.description: specifies the number of payment periods.

arguments.name: principal-amount
arguments.description: specifies the principal amount of the loan. Zero is assumed if a missing value is specified.

arguments.name: future-amount
arguments.description: specifies the future amount. Future-amount can be the outstanding balance of a loan after the specified number of payment periods, or the future balance of periodic savings. Zero is assumed if future-amount is omitted or if a missing value is specified.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: specifies whether the payments occur at the beginning or end of a period. 0 represents the end-of-period payments, and 1 represents the beginning-of-period payments. 0 is assumed if type is omitted or if a missing value is specified.

name: IQR
description: Returns the interquartile range.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression for which the interquartile range is to be computed.

name: IRR
description: Returns the internal rate of return as a percentage.

arguments.name: frequency
arguments.description: is numeric, the number of payments over a specified base period of time that is associated with the desired internal rate of return.

arguments.name: c1,
arguments.description: are numeric, the optional cash payments.

name: ISNULL
description: Determines whether a pointer element of a structure is null.

arguments.name: numeric-variable
arguments.description: specifies a numeric value.

arguments.name: pointer-element
arguments.description: specifies a variable that contains the address of another variable.

name: JBESSEL
description: Returns the value of the Bessel function.

arguments.name: nu
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: JSONPP
description: Creates a readable copy of JSON input.

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: specifies the JSON input file. The input file can be a physical name or a fileref.

arguments.name: output
arguments.description: specifies the readable JSON file. The output file can be a physical name or a fileref. If the output file is LOG, then the output is written to the SAS log.

name: JULDATE
description: Returns the Julian date from a SAS date value.

arguments.name: date
arguments.description: specifies a SAS date value.

name: JULDATE7
description: Returns a seven-digit Julian date from a SAS date value.

arguments.name: date
arguments.description: specifies a SAS date value.

name: KCHARLIST
description: Returns the character list according to the modifier.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the KCHARLIST function. Use the following characters as modifiers:

name: KCOMPARE
description: Returns the result of a comparison of character expressions.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies the character expression to be compared.

arguments.name: findstr
arguments.description: specifies the character expression to compare to source.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: specifies the starting position in source to begin the comparison. If pos is omitted, the entire source is compared. If pos is less than 0, source is assumed as extended DBCS data that does not contain any SO/SI characters.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: specifies the number of bytes to compare. If count is omitted, all of source that follows pos is compared, except for any trailing blanks.

name: KCOMPRESS
description: Removes specified characters from a character expression.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies a character expression that contains the characters to be removed. When only source is specified, KCOMPRESS returns this expression with all of the single and double-byte blanks removed.

arguments.name: characters-to-remove
arguments.description: specifies the character or characters that KCOMPRESS removes from the character. If characters-to-remove is omitted, KCOMPRESS removes all blank expressions.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the KCOMPRESS function. Full-width alphabetic and numeric characters are supported. Blanks are ignored. The following characters can be used as modifiers:

name: KCOUNT
description: Returns the number of double-byte characters in an expression.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies the character expression to count.

name: KCOUNTC
description: counts individual characters in a character string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which characters are counted.

arguments.name: character-list
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. The KCOUNTC function counts characters in this list, provided that you do not specify the V modifier in the modifier argument. If you specify the V modifier, then all characters that are not in this list are counted. You can add more characters to the list by using other modifiers.

arguments.name: modifer
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the actions of the KCOUNTC function. Blanks are ignored. The following characters, in uppercase or lowercase, can be used as modifiers:

name: KCOUNTW
description: Counts the number of words in a character string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which words are counted.

arguments.name: character-list
arguments.description: specifies an optional character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. The characters in this list are delimiters that separate words. However, if you specify the K modifier in the modifier argument, then all characters, including the characters in the list, are treated as delimiters. To add more characters to the list, use other modifiers. Delimiter refers to any of several characters that you can specify to separate words.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the actions of the KCOUNTW function. The following characters can be used as modifiers:

name: KCOUNTX
description: Counts the number of times that a specified substring appears within a character string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which substrings are counted.

arguments.name: substring
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the substring of characters to count in string.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one or more modifiers. The following modifiers can be in uppercase or lowercase:

name: KCVT
description: Converts data from one type of encoding data to another type of encoding data.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: specifies the character variable to be converted.

arguments.name: intype
arguments.description: specifies the encoding of the data. The encoding of the text must match the input data's encoding. For valid values, see .

arguments.name: outtype
arguments.description: specifies the encoding to be converted into character data. For valid values, see .

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: specifies character data options. Here are the available options:

name: KFIND
description: Searches for a specific substring of characters within a character string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is searched for substrings.

arguments.name: substring
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the substring of characters to search for in string.

arguments.name: i
arguments.description: ignores character case during the search. If this modifier is not specified, KFIND searches only for character substrings with the same case as the characters in substring.

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: trims trailing blanks from string and substring.

arguments.name: start-position
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction of the search.

name: KFINDC
description: Searches a string for any character in a list of characters.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to search.

arguments.name: character-list
arguments.description: is a constant, variable, or character expression that initializes a list of characters. The KFINDC function searches for the characters in this list provided that you do not specify the K modifier in the modifier argument. If you specify the K modifier, the KFINDC function searches for all characters that are not in this list of characters. You can add more characters to the list by using other modifiers.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression in which each character modifies the actions of the KFINDC function. The following characters, in uppercase or lowercase, can be used as modifiers:

arguments.name: start-position
arguments.description: is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: KFINDW
description: Returns the character position of a word in a string or the number of the word in a string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies which character string to search.

arguments.name: word
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the word to search for in string.

arguments.name: character-list
arguments.description: is an optional character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters.

arguments.name: start-position
arguments.description: is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should begin and the direction in which to search.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the actions of the KFINDW function.

name: KINDEX
description: Searches a character expression for a string of characters.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies the character expression to search.

arguments.name: excerpt
arguments.description: specifies the string of characters to search for in the character expression.

name: KINDEXB
description: Searches a character expression for specified characters and returns byte-based values.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies the character expression to search for.

arguments.name: excerpt
arguments.description: specifies the string of characters to search for in the character expression.

name: KINDEXC
description: Searches a character expression for specified characters and returns character-based values.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies the character expression to search for.

arguments.name: excerpt-1,
arguments.description: specifies the characters to search for in the character expression.

name: KINDEXCB
description: Searches a character expression for specified characters and returns byte-based values.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies the character expression to search for.

arguments.name: excerpt-1,
arguments.description: specifies the characters to search for in the character expression.

name: KLEFT
description: Left-aligns a character expression by removing unnecessary leading DBCS blanks and SO/SI.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies any SAS character expression.

name: KLENGTH
description: Returns the length, in characters, of an argument.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies any SAS expression.

name: KLOWCASE
description: Converts the uppercase alphabetic letters to lowercase letters.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies any SAS character expression.

name: KNEXTCHAR
description: Returns a character from a string at a specified byte offset.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: a number that represents the byte-based input and output value. The initial value of offset must be 1.

name: KOFFSET
description: Returns the byte offset from the character position.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: character_position
arguments.description: specifies a position in the character string.

name: KPROPCASE
description: Converts Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Taiwanese (CJKT) characters.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: data string that has been converted and is in the current SAS session encoding.

arguments.name: instr
arguments.description: input data string.

arguments.name: HALF-KATAKANA,
arguments.description: This option converts half-width katakana to full-width katakana and is used only with Japanese encoding.

arguments.name: FULL-KATAKANA,
arguments.description: This option converts full-width katakana to half-width katakana and is used only with Japanese encoding.

arguments.name: KATAKANA,
arguments.description: This option converts the katakana character string to a romaji character string and is used only with Japanese encoding.

arguments.name: ROMAJI,
arguments.description: This option converts the romaji character string to a katakana character string and is used only with Japanese encoding.

arguments.name: FULL-ALPHABET,
arguments.description: This option converts the Full-Alphabet characters to Half-Alphabet characters and is used only with Japanese, Chinese, Korean, and Taiwanese encoding.

arguments.name: HALF-ALPHABET,
arguments.description: This option converts the Half-Alphabet characters to Full-Alphabet characters and is used only with Japanese, Chinese, Korean, and Taiwanese encoding.

arguments.name: LOWERCASE,
arguments.description: This option converts lowercase alphabet characters to uppercase alphabet characters.

arguments.name: UPPERCASE,
arguments.description: This option converts uppercase alphabet characters to lowercase alphabet characters.

arguments.name: PROPER
arguments.description:
This option specifies the following default options based on the encoding:
• Japanese encoding 
• Half-Katakana,Full-Katakana
• Full-alphabet, Half-alphabet
• Lowercase, Uppercase
• Korean encoding: 
• Full-alphabet, Half-alphabet
• Chinese encoding:
• Full-alphabet, Half-alphabet
• Taiwanese encoding: 
• Full-alphabet, Half-alphabet

name: KPROPCHAR
description: Converts Unicode to the corresponding characters enclosed in parenthesis.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: result string. Unicode is converted to characters.

arguments.name: instr
arguments.description: input data string.

name: KPROPDATA
description: Removes or converts unprintable characters.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: specifies a data string that has been converted and is in the session encoding.

arguments.name: instr
arguments.description: specifies the input data string.

arguments.name: UESC
arguments.description: Converts unprintable characters using a Unicode escaped string (for example, \u0000\u1234).

arguments.name: TRIM
arguments.description: Removes unprintable characters. No replacement character is used.

arguments.name: BLANK
arguments.description: Replaces each unprintable character with a single-byte blank.

arguments.name: QUESTION
arguments.description: Replaces unprintable characters with a single-byte '?'.

arguments.name: HEX
arguments.description: Replaces unprintable characters with a hexadecimal representation (for example, 0x810x82).

arguments.name: TRUNCATE
arguments.description: Truncates the data string when the first unprintable character is encountered.

arguments.name: REMOVE
arguments.description: Removes the data string if any unprintable characters are found.

arguments.name: NCR
arguments.description: Encodes the unprintable characters using NCR representation if the code is available in Unicode.

arguments.name: PUNC
arguments.description: Converts commonly used 8-bit punctuation marks to 7-bit characters.

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: specifies the input data's encoding name if necessary. If the input encode name is not specified, then the KPROPDATA function processes the data as the current SAS session encoded string. For information about SAS encoding names, see .

arguments.name: output
arguments.description: specifies the output data's encoding name. If the encoding name is not specified, the KPROPDATA function recognizes the output as the current SAS session encoding. For information about SAS encoding names, see .

name: KREVERSE
description: Reverses a character expression.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies any SAS character expression.

name: KRIGHT
description: Right-aligns a character expression by trimming trailing DBCS blanks and SO/SI.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies any SAS character expression.

name: KSCAN
description: Selects a specified word from a character expression.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies any character expression.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a numeric expression that produces the number of the word in the character expression that you want KSCAN to select.

arguments.name: delimiters
arguments.description: specifies a character variable that produces characters that you want KSCAN to use as word separators in the character expression.

name: KSCANX
description: Selects a specified word from a character expression using a modifier to process the function’s action.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: is a nonzero numeric constant, variable, or expression that has an integer value. The integer value specifies the number of the word in the character string that you want KSCANX to select. For example, a value of 1 indicates the first word, a value of 2 indicates the second word, and so on. The following rules apply: • If count is positive, KSCANX counts words from left to right in the character string. • If count is negative, KSCANX counts words from right to left in the character string.

arguments.name: character-list
arguments.description: specifies an optional character expression that initializes a list of characters. This list determines which characters are used as the delimiters that separate words. The following rules apply: • By default, all characters in character-list are used as delimiters. • Specifying a modifier can also change the character-list used as delimiters. For example, if you specify the K modifier in the modifier argument, then all characters that are not in character-list are used as delimiters.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the KSCANX function. Blanks are ignored. Use the following characters as modifiers:

name: KSTRCAT
description: Concatenates two or more character expressions.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies any single-byte or double-byte character expression.

name: KSTRIP
description: Removes leading and trailing blanks from a character string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: KSUBSTR

arguments.name: position

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a numeric expression that is the length of the substring to extract.

name: KSUBSTRB
description: Extracts a substring from an argument according to the byte position of the substring in the argument.

arguments.description: specifies any SAS character expression.

arguments.name: position

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the length of the substring to extract in byte units.

name: KSUBSTRN
description: Returns a substring, allowing a result with a length of zero.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character or numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: is an integer that specifies the position of the first character in the substring.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: is an integer that specifies the length of the substring. If you do not specify length, the KSUBSTRN function returns the substring that extends from the position that you specify to the end of the string.

name: KTRANSLATE
description: Replaces specified characters in a character expression.

arguments.name: source

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: specifies the characters that you want KTRANSLATE to use as substitutes.

arguments.name: from
arguments.description: specifies the characters that you want KTRANSLATE to replace.

name: KTRIM
description: Removes trailing DBCS blanks and SO/SI from character expressions.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies any SAS character expression.

name: KTRUNCATE
description: Truncates a string to a specified length in byte unit without breaking multibyte characters.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies any SAS character expression.

arguments.name: number
arguments.description: is numeric.

arguments.name: length

name: KUPCASE
description: Converts the lowercase alphabetic letters to uppercase letters.

arguments.name: argument

name: KUPDATE

name: LARGEST

name: LENGTHC

name: LEXCOMB

arguments.name: variable

name: LEXPERM

arguments.name: variable
