arguments.name: libref
arguments.description: specifies the libref that is assigned to a SAS library.

arguments.name: SAS-library
arguments.description: specifies the physical name of the SAS library that is associated with the libref. Specify this name as required by the host operating environment. This argument can be null.

arguments.name: engine
arguments.description: specifies the engine that is used to access SAS files opened in the data library. If you are specifying a SAS/SHARE server, then the value of engine should be REMOTE. This argument can be null.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: specifies one or more valid options for the specified engine, delimited with blanks. This argument can be null.

name: LIBREF
description: Verifies that a libref has been assigned.

arguments.name: libref
arguments.description: specifies the libref to be verified. In a DATA step, libref can be a character expression, a string enclosed in quotation marks, or a DATA step variable whose value contains the libref. In a macro, libref can be any expression.

name: LIMMOMENT
description: Computes the limited moment of any distribution for which you have defined a cumulative distribution function (CDF).

syntax.help:
imom=LIMMOMENT ('CDF-function-name', options-array, order, limit, 
	
	parameter-1 <, parameter-2, ...>);

arguments.name: imom
arguments.description: specifies the limited moment that is returned from the LIMMOMENT function.

arguments.name: 'CDF-function-name'
arguments.description: specifies the name of the CDF function. Enclose CDF-function-name in quotation marks.

arguments.name: desired-accuracy
arguments.description: specifies the desired accuracy of the numerical integration. You can specify any value in the range (0,0.1). If you specify a smaller value, the result is a more accurate estimate of the moment, but it takes longer to compute the desired-accuracy.

arguments.name: initial-step-size
arguments.description: specifies the step size that is used initially by the numerical integration process. An increase in the value results in a linear decrease in the number of times the integrand is evaluated. Typically, using the default value of 1 produces good results.

arguments.name: maximum-iterations
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations that are used to refine the integration result in order to achieve the desired accuracy. An increase in this value results in an exponential increase in the number of times the integrand is evaluated.

indicates success. If negative, then the absolute value is the number of times the integrand function was evaluated in order to compute the limited moment. A larger absolute value indicates longer convergence time.
indicates that the limited moment could not be computed.

arguments.name: order
arguments.description: specifies the order of the desired limited moment.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: specifies the upper limit that is used to compute the desired limited moment.

arguments.name: parameter
arguments.description: specifies the parameters of the distribution at which the limited moment is desired. You must specify exactly the same number of parameters as required by the specified CDF function, and they should appear exactly in the same order as required by the specified CDF function.

name: LOG
description: Returns the natural (base e) logarithm.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: LOG10
description: Returns the logarithm to the base 10.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: LOG1PX
description: Returns the log of 1 plus the argument.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable, constant, or expression.

name: LOG2
description: Returns the logarithm to the base 2.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: LOGBETA
description: Returns the logarithm of the beta function.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: is the first shape parameter, where a>0.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: is the second shape parameter, where b>0.

name: LOGCDF
description: Returns the logarithm of a left cumulative distribution function.

arguments.name: 'distribution'
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.

arguments.name: quantile
arguments.description: is a numeric variable, constant, or expression that specifies the value of a random variable.

arguments.name: parameter-1,
arguments.description: are optional shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

name: LOGISTIC
description: Returns the logistic transformation of the argument.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: is a numeric variable, constant, or expression that specifies the value of a numeric random variable. When argument is missing, the LOGISTIC function returns a missing value.

name: LOGPDF
description: Returns the logarithm of a probability density (mass) function.

arguments.name: 'distribution'
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.

arguments.name: quantile
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value of a random variable.

arguments.name: parameter-1,
arguments.description: are optional shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

name: LOGSDF
description: Returns the logarithm of a survival function.

arguments.name: 'distribution'
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.

arguments.name: quantile
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value of a random variable.

arguments.name: parameter-1,
arguments.description: are optional shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

name: LOWCASE
description: Converts all uppercase single-width English alphabet letters in an argument to lowercase.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: LOWER
description: Converts the case of a character string to lowercase.

arguments.name: sql-expression
arguments.description: See .

name: LPERM
description: Computes the logarithm of the PERM function, which is the logarithm of the number of permutations of n objects, with the option of including r number of elements.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is an integer that represents the total number of elements from which the sample is chosen.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is an optional integer value that represents the number of chosen elements. If r is omitted, the function returns the factorial of n.

name: LPNORM
description: Returns the Lp norm of the second argument and subsequent nonmissing arguments.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that is greater than or equal to 1, which is used as the power for computing the Lp norm.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: MAD
description: Returns the median absolute deviation from the median.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression of which the median absolute deviation from the median is to be computed.

name: MARGRCLPRC
description: Calculates call prices for European options on stocks, based on the Margrabe model.

arguments.name: X1
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the price of the first asset.

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: is a nonmissing value that specifies the time to expiration, in years.

arguments.name: X2
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the price of the second asset.

arguments.name: sigma-1
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the first asset.

arguments.name: sigma-2
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the second asset.

arguments.name: rho12
arguments.description: specifies the correlation between the first and second assets, rho sub x sub 1 , x sub 2 end sub ρx1x2 .

name: MARGRPTPRC
description: Calculates put prices for European options on stocks, based on the Margrabe model.

arguments.name: X1
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the price of the first asset.

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: is a nonmissing value that specifies the time to expiration, in years.

arguments.name: X2
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the price of the second asset.

arguments.name: sigma-1
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the first asset.

arguments.name: sigma-2
arguments.description: is a nonmissing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the second asset.

arguments.name: rho12
arguments.description: specifies the correlation between the first and second assets, rho sub x sub 1 , y sub 1 end sub ρx1y1.

name: MAX
description: Returns the largest value.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least one argument is required. If you use only one argument, then the value of that argument is returned. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.

name: MD5
description: Returns an MD5 message digest as a 16-byte binary string for a message consisting of a character string.

arguments.name: message
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: MDY
description: Returns a SAS date value from month, day, and year values.

arguments.name: month
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents an integer from 1 through 12.

arguments.name: day
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents an integer from 1 through 31.

arguments.name: year
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression with a value of a two-digit or four-digit integer that represents the year. The YEARCUTOFF= system option defines the year value for two-digit dates.

name: MEAN
description: Returns the arithmetic mean (average).

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least one nonmissing argument is required. Otherwise, the function returns a missing value.

name: MEDIAN
description: Returns the median value.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: MIN
description: Returns the smallest value.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least one argument is required. If you use only one argument, then the value of that argument is returned. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.

name: MINUTE
description: Returns the minute from a SAS time or datetime value.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies a SAS time value.

arguments.name: datetime
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies a SAS datetime value.

name: MISSING
description: Returns a numeric result that indicates whether the argument contains a missing value.

arguments.name: numeric-expression
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: character-expression
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: MOD
description: Returns the remainder from the division of the first argument by the second argument, fuzzed to avoid most unexpected floating-point results.

arguments.name: argument-1
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the dividend.

arguments.name: argument-2
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the divisor.

name: MODEXIST
description: Determines whether a software image exists in the version of SAS that you have installed.

arguments.name: 'product-name'
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is the name of the product image that you are checking.

arguments.name: 'pathname'
arguments.description: specifies the pathname for the product image that you are checking.

name: MODULE
description: Calls a specific routine or module that resides in an external dynamic link library (DLL).

arguments.name: module
arguments.description: is the name of the external module to use, specified as a DLL name and the routine name or ordinal value, separated by a comma. The module must reside in a dynamic link library (DLL) and it must be externally callable. For example, the value 'KERNEL32,GetProfileString' specifies to load KERNEL32.DLL and to invoke the GetProfileString routine. Note that while the DLL name is not case sensitive, the routine name is based on the restraints of the routine's implementation language, so the routine name is case sensitive.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: are the arguments to pass to the requested routine. Use the proper attributes for the arguments (numeric arguments for numeric attributes and character arguments for character attributes).

arguments.name: control-string
arguments.description: is an optional control string whose first character must be an asterisk (*), followed by any combination of characters.

name: MODULEC
description: Calls an external routine and returns a character value.

name: MODULEN
description: Calls an external routine and returns a numeric value.

name: MODZ
description: Returns the remainder from the division of the first argument by the second argument, using zero fuzzing.

arguments.name: argument-1
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the dividend.

arguments.name: argument-2
arguments.description: is a nonzero numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the divisor.

name: MONTH
description: Returns the month from a SAS date value.

arguments.name: date
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents a SAS date value.

name: MOPEN
description: Opens a file by directory ID and member name, and returns either the file identifier or a 0.

arguments.name: directory-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened, generally by the DOPEN function.

arguments.name: member-name
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the member name in the directory.

arguments.name: open-mode
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the type of access to the file.

arguments.name: record-length
arguments.description: is a numeric variable, constant, or expression that specifies a new logical record length for the file. To use the existing record length for the file, specify a length of 0, or do not provide a value here.

arguments.name: record-format
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies a new record format for the file. To use the existing record format, do not specify a value here.

name: MORT
description: Returns amortization parameters.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: is numeric, and specifies the initial amount.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, and specifies the periodic payment.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is numeric, and specifies the periodic interest rate that is expressed as a fraction.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is an integer, and specifies the number of compounding periods.

name: MSPLINT
description: Returns the ordinate of a monotonicity-preserving interpolating spline.

arguments.name: X
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the abscissa for which the ordinate of the spline is to be computed.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of knots. N must be a positive integer.

arguments.name: X1,
arguments.description: are numeric constants, variables, or expressions that specify the abscissas of the knots. These values must be nonmissing and listed in nondecreasing order. Otherwise, the result is undefined. MSPLINT does not check the order of the X1 through Xn arguments.

arguments.name: Y1,
arguments.description: are numeric constants, variables, or expressions that specify the ordinates of the knots. The number of Y1 through Yn arguments must be the same as the number of X1 throughXn arguments.

arguments.name: D1,
arguments.description: are optional numeric constants, variables, or expressions that specify the derivatives of the spline at X1 and Xn. These derivatives affect only abscissas that are less than X2 or greater than x sub n minus 1 end sub Xn-1.

name: MVALID
description: Checks the validity of a character string for use as a SAS member name.

arguments.name: libname
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that associates a SAS library with a libref. Leading and trailing blanks are ignored.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is checked to determine whether its value can be used as a SAS member name. Leading and trailing blanks are ignored.

arguments.name: member-type
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is the member type of the member name that you are using. Leading and trailing blanks are ignored. The value of member-type is not validated.

arguments.name: COMPAT
arguments.description: determines that string is a valid SAS member name when all three of the following conditions are true: • The string argument begins with an English letter or an underscore. • All subsequent characters are English letters, underscores, or digits. • The length of string is 32 or fewer alphanumeric characters.

arguments.name: COMPATIBLE
arguments.description: determines that string is a valid SAS member name when all three of the following conditions are true: • The string argument begins with an English letter or an underscore. • All subsequent characters are English letters, underscores, or digits. • The length of string is 32 or fewer alphanumeric characters.

arguments.name: EXTEND
arguments.description: determines that string is a valid SAS member name when all of the following conditions are true: • The length of string is 32 or fewer bytes. • The string argument does not contain the characters / \ * ? " < > | : – • The string argument does not contain null bytes. • The string argument does not begin with a blank or period (.). • The string argument contains at least one character. A name that consists of all blanks is not valid.

name: N
description: Returns the number of nonmissing numeric values.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least one argument is required. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.

name: NDIMS
description: Returns the number of dimensions in an array.

arguments.name: array-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the array.

arguments.name: rc
arguments.description: specifies the variable to return the number of dimensions to.

name: NETPV
description: Returns the net present value as a percent.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is numeric, the interest rate over a specified base period of time expressed as a fraction.

arguments.name: frequency
arguments.description: is numeric, the number of payments during the base period of time that is specified with the rate r.

arguments.name: c0,
arguments.description: are numeric cash flows that represent cash outlays (payments) or cash inflows (income) occurring at times 0, 1, ... n. These cash flows are assumed to be equally spaced, beginning-of-period values. Negative values represent payments, positive values represent income, and values of 0 represent no cash flow at a given time. The c0 argument and the c1 argument are required.

name: NLDATE
description: Converts the SAS date value to the date value of the specified locale by using the date format descriptors.

arguments.name: date
arguments.description: specifies a SAS date value.
removes the leading zero from the result.
specifies the % character.

arguments.name: %a
arguments.description: specifies the short-weekday descriptor. The range for the day descriptor is Mon–Sun.

arguments.name: %A
arguments.description: specifies the long-weekday descriptor. The range for the long-weekday descriptor is Monday–Sunday.

arguments.name: %b
arguments.description: specifies the short-month descriptor. The range for the short-month descriptor is Jan–Dec.

arguments.name: %B
arguments.description: specifies the long-month descriptor. The range for the long-month descriptor is January–December.

arguments.name: %C
arguments.description: specifies the long-month descriptor and uses blank padding. The range for the long-month descriptor is January–December.

arguments.name: %d
arguments.description: specifies the day descriptor and uses 0 padding. The range for the day modifier is 01–31.

arguments.name: %e
arguments.description: specifies the day descriptor and uses blank padding. The range for the day descriptor is 01–31.

arguments.name: %F
arguments.description: specifies the long-weekday descriptor and uses blank padding. The range for the day descriptor is Monday–Sunday.

arguments.name: %j
arguments.description: specifies the day-of-year descriptor as a decimal number and uses a leading zero. The range for the day-of-year descriptor is 1–366.

arguments.name: %m
arguments.description: specifies the month descriptor and uses 0 padding. The range for the month descriptor is 01–12.

arguments.name: %o
arguments.description: specifies the month descriptor. The range for the month descriptor is 1–12 with blank padding.

arguments.name: %u
arguments.description: specifies the weekday descriptor as a number in the range 1–7 that represents Monday–Sunday.

arguments.name: %U
arguments.description: specifies the week-number-of-year descriptor by calculating the descriptor value as the SAS date value using the number of week within the year (Sunday is considered the first day of the week). The number-of-the-week value is represented as a decimal number in the range 0–53 and uses a leading zero and a maximum value of 53.

arguments.name: %V
arguments.description: specifies the week-number-of-year descriptor by calculating the descriptor value as the SAS date value. The number-of-week value is represented as a decimal number in the range 01–53 and uses a leading zero and a maximum value of 53. Weeks begin on a Monday and week 1 of the year is the week that includes both January 4 and the first Thursday of the year. If the first Monday of January is the 2nd, 3rd, or 4th, the preceding days are part of the last week of the preceding year.

arguments.name: %w
arguments.description: specifies the weekday descriptor as a number in the range 0–6 that represents Sunday–Saturday.

arguments.name: %W
arguments.description: specifies the week-number-of-year descriptor by calculating the descriptor value as SAS date value by using the number of week within the year (Monday is considered the first day of the week). The number-of-week value is represented as a decimal number in the range 0–53 and uses a leading zero and a maximum value of 53.

arguments.name: %y
arguments.description: specifies the year (2-digit) modifier. The range for the year descriptor is 00–99.

arguments.name: %Y
arguments.description: specifies the year (4-digit) descriptor. The range for the year descriptor is 1970–2069.

name: NLDATM
description: Converts the SAS datetime value to the time value of the specified locale by using the datetime-format descriptors.

arguments.name: datetime
arguments.description: specifies a SAS datetime value.
removes the leading zero from the result.
specifies the % character.

arguments.name: %a

arguments.name: %A

arguments.name: %b

arguments.name: %d

arguments.name: %e
arguments.description: specifies the day descriptor and uses blank padding. The range for the day descriptor is 01–31.

arguments.name: %F
arguments.description: specifies the long-weekday descriptor and uses blank padding. The range for the day descriptor is Monday–Sunday.

arguments.name: %H
arguments.description: specifies the hour descriptor that is based on a 24-hour clock. The range for the hour descriptor is 00–23.

arguments.name: %I
arguments.description: specifies the hour descriptor that is based on a 12-hour clock. The range for the hour descriptor is 01–12.

arguments.name: %j
arguments.description: specifies the day-of-year descriptor as a decimal number and uses a leading zero. The range for the day-of-year descriptor is 1–366.

arguments.name: %m
arguments.description: specifies the month descriptor and uses 0 padding. The range for the month descriptor is 01–12.

arguments.name: %M
arguments.description: specifies the minute descriptor. The range for the minute descriptor is 00–59.

arguments.name: %o
arguments.description: specifies the month descriptor and uses blank padding. The range for the month descriptor is 1–12.

arguments.name: %p
arguments.description: specifies a.m. or p.m. descriptor.

arguments.name: %S
arguments.description: specifies the second descriptor. The range for the second descriptor is 00–59.

arguments.name: %u
arguments.description: specifies the weekday descriptor as a number in the range of 1–7 that represents Monday–Sunday.

arguments.name: %U
arguments.description: specifies the week-number-of-year descriptor by calculating the descriptor value as the SAS date value and uses the number-of-week value within the year (Sunday is considered the first day of the week). The number-of-week value is represented as a decimal number in the range 0–53. A leading zero and a maximum value of 53 is used.

arguments.name: %V
arguments.description: specifies the week-number-of-year descriptor by calculating the descriptor value as the SAS date value. The number-of-week value is represented as a decimal number in the range 01–53. A leading zero and a maximum value of 53 is used. Weeks begin on a Monday and week 1 of the year is the week that includes both January 4 and the first Thursday of the year. If the first Monday of January is the 2nd, 3rd, or 4th, the preceding days are part of the last week of the preceding year.

arguments.name: %w
arguments.description: specifies the weekday descriptor as a number in the range of 0–6 that represents Sunday–Saturday.

arguments.name: %W
arguments.description: specifies the week-number-of-year descriptor by calculating the descriptor value as SAS date value using the number of week within the year (Monday is considered the first day of the week). The number-of-week value is represented as a decimal number in the range of 0–53. A leading zero and a maximum value of 53 are used.

arguments.name: %y
arguments.description: specifies the year (2-digit) descriptor. The range for the year descriptor is 00–99.

arguments.name: %Y
arguments.description: specifies the year (4-digit) descriptor. The range for the year descriptor is 1970–2069.

name: NLITERAL
description: Converts a character string that you specify to a SAS name literal.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is to be converted to a SAS name literal.

name: NLTIME
description: Converts the SAS time or the datetime value to the time value of the specified locale by using the NLTIME descriptors.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: specifies a SAS time value.

arguments.name: datetime
arguments.description: specifies a SAS datetime value.
removes the leading zero from the result.
specifies the % character.

arguments.name: %H
arguments.description: specifies the hour descriptor that is based on a 24-hour clock. The range for the hour descriptor is 00–23.

arguments.name: %I

arguments.name: startpos
arguments.description: is an integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and that specifies the direction of the search.

name: NMISS
description: Returns the number of missing values in a table column.

arguments.name: sql-expression
arguments.description: specifies any valid SQL expression. See .

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: (default) specifies that all missing values returned by sql-expression be counted.

arguments.name: DISTINCT
arguments.description: eliminates duplicate rows returned by sql-expression from the count.

name: NOMRATE
description: Returns the nominal annual interest rate.

arguments.name: compounding-interval
arguments.description: is a SAS interval. This value represents how often the returned value is compounded.

arguments.name: rate
arguments.description: is numeric. Rate is the effective annual interest rate (expressed as a percentage) that is compounded at each interval.

name: NORMAL
description: Returns a random variate from a normal, or Gaussian, distribution.

name: NOTALNUM
description: Searches a character string for a non-alphanumeric character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: NOTALPHA
description: Searches a character string for a nonalphabetic character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: NOTCNTRL
description: Searches a character string for a character that is not a control character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: NOTDIGIT
description: Searches a character string for any character that is not a digit, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: NOTE
description: Returns an observation ID for the current observation of a SAS data set.

arguments.name: data-set-id
arguments.description: is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.

name: NOTFIRST
description: Searches a character string for an invalid first character in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: NOTGRAPH
description: Searches a character string for a non-graphical character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

name: NOTLOWER
description: Searches a character string for a character that is not a lowercase letter, and returns the first position at which that character is found.

arguments.name: string

arguments.description: are numeric cash flows that represent cash outlays (payments) or cash inflows (income) occurring at times 0, 1, ... n. These cash flows are assumed to be equally spaced, beginning-of-period values. Negative values represent payments, positive values represent income, and values of 0 represent no cash flow at a given time. The c0 argument and the c1 argument are required.

name: NVALID

arguments.description: determines that string is a valid SAS variable name when all three of the following are true: • string begins with an English letter or an underscore • All subsequent characters are English letters, underscores, or digits • The length is 32 or fewer alphanumeric characters

arguments.name: ANY
arguments.description: determines that string is a valid SAS variable name if it contains 32 or fewer characters of any type, including blanks.

arguments.name: NLITERAL
arguments.description: determines that string is a valid SAS variable name if it is in the form of a SAS name literal ('name'N) or if it is a valid SAS variable name when VALIDVARNAME=V7.

arguments.name: UPCASE
arguments.description: determines that string is a valid SAS variable name that is in uppercase.

name: PMT

arguments.description: specifies the interest rate per payment period.

arguments.name: number-of-periods
arguments.description: specifies the number of payment periods.

arguments.name: future-amount
arguments.description: specifies the future amount. Future-amount can be the outstanding balance of a loan after the specified number of payment periods, or the future balance of periodic savings. Zero is assumed if future-amount is omitted or if a missing value is specified.

arguments.description: specifies whether the payments occur at the beginning or end of a period. 0 represents the end-of-period payments, and 1 represents the beginning-of-period payments. 0 is assumed if type is omitted or if a missing value is specified.

arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that identifies the capture buffer for which to retrieve a value: • If the value of capture-buffer is zero, PRXPOSN returns the entire match. • If the value of capture-buffer is between 1 and the number of open parentheses in the regular expression, then PRXPOSN returns the value for that capture buffer. • If the value of capture-buffer is greater than the number of open parentheses, then PRXPOSN returns a missing value.

name: PUT

arguments.description: identifies the constant, variable, or expression whose value you want to reformat. The source argument can be character or numeric.

arguments.name: format.
arguments.description: contains the SAS format that you want applied to the value that is specified in the source. This argument must be the name of a format with a period and optional width and decimal specifications, not a character constant, variable, or expression. By default, if the source is numeric, the resulting string is right aligned, and if the source is character, the result is left aligned. To override the default alignment, you can add an alignment specification to a format.

name: READ_ARRAY
description: Reads data from a SAS data set into a PROC FCMP array variable.

arguments.description: is 0 if the function is able to successfully read the data set.

arguments.name: data_set_name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the data set from which the array data is read. Data_set_name must be a character literal or variable that contains the member name (libname.memname) of the data set to be read from.

arguments.name: array_variable
arguments.description: specifies the PROC FCMP array variable into which the data is read. Array_variable must be a local temporary array variable because the function might need to grow or shrink its size to accommodate the size of the data set.

arguments.description: specifies optional names for the specific columns of the data set that are read.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression to be rounded.

arguments.name: rounding-unit
arguments.description: is a positive, numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the rounding unit.

name: ROUNDZ
description: Rounds the first argument to the nearest multiple of the second argument, using zero fuzzing.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression to be rounded.

arguments.name: rounding-unit
arguments.description: is a positive, numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the rounding unit.

name: RUN_MACRO
description: Executes a predefined SAS macro.

arguments.name: rc
arguments.description: is 0 if the function is able to submit the macro. The return code indicates only that the macro call was attempted. The macro itself should set the value of a SAS macro variable that corresponds to a PROC FCMP variable to determine whether the macro executed as expected.

arguments.name: macro_name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the macro to be run.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies optional PROC FCMP variables, which are set by macro variables of the same name. These arguments must be PROC FCMP double or character variables.

name: RUN_SASFILE
description: Executes SAS code in a fileref that you specify.

arguments.name: rc
arguments.description: is 0 if the function is able to submit a request to execute the code that processes the SAS file. The return code indicates only that the call was attempted.

arguments.name: fileref_name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS fileref that points to the SAS code.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies optional PROC FCMP variables that are set by macro variables of the same name. These arguments must be PROC FCMP double or character variables.

name: SASMSG
description: Specifies a message from a data set. The returned message is based on the current locale and a specified key.

arguments.name: BASENAME
arguments.description: the name of the data set where the message is located.

arguments.name: KEY
arguments.description: the message key.

arguments.name: QUOTE
arguments.description: specifies the type of quotation marks that are added to the message text and substitution strings.

arguments.name: substitution
arguments.description: string substitutions. The maximum string substitutions is 7.

name: SASMSGL
description: Specifies a message from a data set. The message is based on a specified locale value and a specified key value.

arguments.name: BASENAME
arguments.description: the name of the data set where the message is located.

arguments.name: KEY
arguments.description: the message key.

arguments.name: LOCALE
arguments.description: the posix locale value (ll_RR).

arguments.name: QUOTE
arguments.description: specifies the type of quotation marks that are added to the message text and substitution strings.

arguments.name: substitution
arguments.description: string substitutions. The maximum string substitutions is 6.

name: SAVING
description: Returns the future value of a periodic saving.

arguments.name: f
arguments.description: is numeric, the future amount (at the end of n periods).

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is numeric, the fixed periodic payment.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: is numeric, the periodic interest rate expressed as a decimal.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is an integer, the number of compounding periods.

name: SAVINGS
description: Returns the balance of a periodic savings by using variable interest rates.

syntax.help:
SAVINGS (base-date, initial-deposit-date, deposit-amount, deposit-number, 
	deposit-interval, compounding-interval, date-1, rate-2 <, date-2, rate-2,  ..., date-n, rate-n>)

arguments.name: base-date
arguments.description: is a SAS date. The value that is returned is the balance of the savings at base-date.

arguments.name: initial-deposit-date
arguments.description: is a SAS date. Initial-deposit-date is the date of the first deposit. Subsequent deposits are at the beginning of subsequent deposit intervals.

arguments.name: deposit-amount
arguments.description: is numeric. All deposits are assumed constant. deposit-amount is the value of each deposit.

arguments.name: deposit-number
arguments.description: is a positive integer. Deposit-number is the number of deposits.

arguments.name: deposit-interval
arguments.description: is a SAS interval. Deposit-interval is the frequency at which deposits are made.

arguments.name: compounding-interval
arguments.description: is a SAS interval. Compounding-interval is the compounding interval.

arguments.name: date
arguments.description: is a SAS date. Each date is paired with a rate. date is the time at which rate takes effect.

arguments.name: rate
arguments.description: is a numeric percentage. Each rate is paired with a date. rate is the interest rate that starts on date.

name: SCAN
description: Returns the nth word from a character string.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: is a nonzero numeric constant, variable, or expression that has an integer value. The integer value specifies the number of the word in the character string that you want SCAN to select. For example, a value of 1 indicates the first word, a value of 2 indicates the second word, and so on. The following rules apply: • If count is positive, SCAN counts words from left to right in the character string. • If count is negative, SCAN counts words from right to left in the character string.

arguments.name: character-list
arguments.description: specifies an optional character expression that initializes a list of characters. This list determines which characters are used as the delimiters that separate words. The following rules apply: • By default, all characters in character-list are used as delimiters. • Specifying a modifier can change the characters in character-list. For example, if you specify the K modifier in the modifier argument, all characters that are not in character-list are used as delimiters.

arguments.name: modifier
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the SCAN function. Blanks are ignored. Use the following characters as modifiers:

name: SDF
description: Returns a survival function.

arguments.name: distribution
arguments.description: is a character string that identifies the distribution.

arguments.name: quantile
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value of a random variable.

arguments.name: parameter-1,
arguments.description: are optional shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

name: SEC
description: Returns the secant.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression and is expressed in radians.

name: SECOND
description: Returns the seconds and milliseconds from a SAS time or datetime value.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with a value that represents a SAS time value.

arguments.name: datetime
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with a value that represents a SAS datetime value.

name: SESSBUSY
description: Determines whether a CAS session is busy processing actions.

arguments.name: session-reference
arguments.description: CAS session name.

arguments.name: uuid
arguments.description: specifies the uuid that you are trying to find. See for more information about uuid.

name: SESSFOUND
description: Returns a 0 when a CAS session is not connected to a server and a 1 when the session is connected to a server.

arguments.name: session-reference
arguments.description: specifies the name of the session that you are trying to find.

arguments.name: uuid
arguments.description: specifies the uuid that you are trying to find. See for more information about uuid.

name: SETLOCALE
description: Specifies the locale keys for the current SAS locale.

syntax.help:
Setting SAS LocaleSETLOCALE  (sas_locale)
Customize single locale elementsSETLOCALE  (key,value)
Customize single locale elements SETLOCALE  (category_name, sas_locale)

arguments.name: sas_locale
arguments.description: specifies a SAS locale name by using the SAS name or the posix name. You can also specify the locale alias.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: specifies a SAS locale element key. See the list of element keys in the Details section.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies a value for the locale element.

arguments.name: category_name
arguments.description:
specifies the category name:
• LC_TIME 
• LC_MONETARY 
• LC_NUMERIC
• LC_ALL

name: SHA256
description: Returns an SHA256 message digest as a 32-byte binary string for a message consisting of a character string.

arguments.name: message
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: SHA256HEX
description: Returns the SHA256 digest for a specified message, and the digest is provided in hexadecimal representation.

arguments.name: 'message'
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: indicates whether the argument message is regular characters or hexadecimal representation characters.

name: SHA256HMACHEX
description: Returns the result of the message digest of a specified string using the HMAC algorithm.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: message
arguments.description: specifies a secret key padded to the right with extra zeros to the input block size of the hash function.

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: indicates whether the key and message are provided in hexadecimal representation.

name: SIGN
description: Returns the sign of a value.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: SIN
description: Returns the sine.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression and is expressed in radians. If the magnitude of argument is so great that mod(argument,pi) is accurate to less than about three decimal places, SIN returns a missing value.

name: SINH
description: Returns the hyperbolic sine.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: SKEWNESS
description: Returns the skewness of the nonmissing arguments.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: SLEEP
description: Suspends the execution of a program that invokes this function for a period of time.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of seconds for which you want to suspend execution of a program. Negative or missing values for n are invalid.

arguments.name: unit
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of seconds that you want to suspend execution of a program. Negative or missing values for n are invalid.

name: SMALLEST
description: Returns the kth smallest nonmissing value.

arguments.name: k
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies which value to return.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: SOLVE
description: Computes implicit values of a function using the Gauss-Newton method.

syntax.help:
answer = SOLVE ('function-name', options-array, expected-value, 
	argument-1 <, argument-2, ...>);

arguments.name: answer
arguments.description: specifies the value that is returned from the SOLVE function.

arguments.name: 'function-name'
arguments.description: specifies the name of the function. Enclose function-name in quotation marks.

arguments.name: initial-value
arguments.description: specifies the starting value for the implied value. The default for the first call is 0.001. If the same line of code is executed again, then options-array uses the previously found implied value.

arguments.name: absolute-criterion
arguments.description: specifies a value for convergence. The absolute value of the difference between the expected value and the predicted value must be less than the value of absolute-criterion for convergence.

arguments.name: relative-criterion
arguments.description: specifies a value for convergence. If the change in the computed implied value is less than the value of relative-criterion, then convergence is assumed.

arguments.name: maximum-iterations
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations to use to find the solution.

arguments.name: solve-status
arguments.description: can be one of the following values:

arguments.name: expected-value
arguments.description: specifies the expected value of the function of interest.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies the arguments to pass to the function that is being minimized.

name: SORT
description: Sorts a list of variables.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: SORTKEY
description: Creates a linguistic sort key.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: character expression

arguments.name: locale
arguments.description: specifies the locale name in the form of a POSIX name (ja_JP). See for a list of locale names and POSIX values.

arguments.name: strength
arguments.description: The value of strength is related to the collation level. There are five collation-level values. The following table provides information about the five levels. The default value for strength is related to the locale.

arguments.name: case
arguments.description: sorts uppercase and lowercase letters. This argument is valid for only TERTIARY, QUATERNARY, or IDENTICAL. The following table provides the values and information for the case order argument.

arguments.name: numeric
arguments.description: orders numbers by the numeric value instead of the number's characters.

arguments.name: collation
arguments.description: There are two types of collation values: Phonebook and Traditional. If you do not select a collation value, then the user's locale-default collation is selected. The following table provides more information.

name: SOUNDEX
description: Encodes a string to facilitate searching.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: SPEDIS
description: Determines the likelihood of two words matching, expressed as the asymmetric spelling distance between the two words.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: identifies the word to query for the likelihood of a match. SPEDIS removes trailing blanks before comparing the value.

arguments.name: keyword
arguments.description: specifies a target word for the query. SPEDIS removes trailing blanks before comparing the value.

name: SQRT
description: Returns the square root of a value.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Argument must be nonnegative.

name: SQUANTILE
description: Returns the quantile from a distribution when you specify the right probability (SDF).

arguments.name: distribution
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.

arguments.name: probability
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value of a random variable.

arguments.name: parameter-1,
arguments.description: are optional shape, location, or scale parameters that are appropriate for the specific distribution.

name: STD
description: Returns the standard deviation of the nonmissing arguments.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least two nonmissing arguments are required. Otherwise, the function returns a missing value. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.

name: STDERR
description: Returns the standard error of the mean of the nonmissing arguments.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least two nonmissing arguments are required. Otherwise, the function returns a missing value. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.

name: STFIPS
description: Converts state postal codes to FIPS state codes.

arguments.name: postal-code
arguments.description: specifies a character expression that contains the two-character standard state postal code. Characters can be mixed case. The function ignores trailing blanks, but generates an error if the expression contains leading blanks.

name: STNAME
description: Converts state postal codes to uppercase state names.

arguments.name: postal-code
arguments.description: specifies a character expression that contains the two-character standard state postal code. Characters can be mixed case. The function ignores trailing blanks, but generates an error if the expression contains leading blanks.

name: STNAMEL
description: Converts state postal codes to mixed case state names.

arguments.name: postal-code
arguments.description: specifies a character expression that contains the two-character standard state postal code. Characters can be mixed case. The function ignores trailing blanks, but generates an error if the expression contains leading blanks.

name: STRIP
description: Returns a character string with all leading and trailing blanks removed.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: SUBPAD
description: Returns a substring that has a length that you specify, using blank padding if necessary.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: is a positive integer that specifies the position of the first character in the substring.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: is a nonnegative integer that specifies the length of the substring. If you do not specify length, the SUBPAD function returns the substring that extends from the position that you specify to the end of the string.

name: SUBSTRING
description: Returns a part of a character expression.

arguments.name: sql-expression
arguments.description: See .

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: is a number (not a variable or column name) that specifies the position, counting from the left end of the character string, at which to begin extracting the substring.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: is a number (not a variable or column name) that specifies the length of the substring that is to be extracted.

name: SUBSTRN
description: Returns a substring, allowing a result with a length of zero.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: specifies a character or numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: is an integer that specifies the position of the first character in the substring.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: is an integer that specifies the length of the substring. If you do not specify length, the SUBSTRN function returns the substring that extends from the position that you specify to the end of the string.

name: SUM
description: Returns the sum of the nonmissing arguments.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description:
specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. If all the arguments have missing values, then one of these actions occurs:
• If you use only one argument, the value of that argument is returned.
• If you use two or more arguments, a standard missing value (.) is returned.

name: SUMABS
description: Returns the sum of the absolute values of the nonmissing arguments.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies a numeric expression.

name: SYMEXIST
description: Returns an indication of the existence of a macro variable.

arguments.name: 'macro-variable-name'
arguments.description: specifies within quotation marks the name of a macro variable without the leading ampersand.

arguments.name: character-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a DATA step character variable that contains the name of a macro variable without the leading ampersand.

arguments.name: character-expression
arguments.description: specifies a character expression that constructs a macro variable name without the leading ampersand.

name: SYMGET
description: Returns the value of a macro variable to the DATA step during DATA step execution.

arguments.name: 'macro-variable-name'
arguments.description: specifies within quotation marks the name of a macro variable without the leading ampersand.

arguments.name: character-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a DATA step character variable that contains the name of a macro variable without the leading ampersand.

arguments.name: character-expression
arguments.description: specifies a character expression that constructs a macro variable name without an ampersand.

name: SYMGETN
description: In SAS Component Control Language (SCL) programs, returns the value of a global macro variable as a numeric value when the SCL program executes.

arguments.name: 'global-macro-variable-name'
arguments.description: specifies within single quotation marks the name of a global macro variable without the leading ampersand.

arguments.name: SCL-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the name of an SCL variable that contains the name of a global macro variable.

name: SYMGLOBL
description: Returns an indication as to whether a macro variable is global in scope to the DATA step during DATA step execution.

arguments.name: 'macro-variable-name'
arguments.description: specifies within quotation marks the name of a macro variable without the leading ampersand.

arguments.name: character-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a DATA step character variable that contains a macro variable name.

arguments.name: character-expression
arguments.description: specifies a character expression that constructs a macro variable name.

name: SYMLOCAL
description: Returns an indication as to whether a macro variable is local in scope to the DATA step during DATA step execution.

arguments.name: 'macro-variable-name'
arguments.description: specifies within quotation marks the name of a macro variable without the leading ampersand.

arguments.name: character-variable-name
arguments.description: specifies without quotation marks the name of a DATA step character variable that contains a macro variable name.

arguments.name: character-expression
arguments.description: specifies a character expression that constructs a macro variable name.

name: SYSEXIST
description: Returns a value that indicates whether an operating-environment variable exists in your environment.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a character variable that is the name of an operating-environment variable that you want to test.

name: SYSGET
description: Returns the value of the specified operating-environment variable.

arguments.name: environment-variable
arguments.description: is a character constant, variable, or expression with a value that is the name of an environment variable under Linux. This argument must be enclosed in single quotation marks.

name: SYSMSG
description: Returns error or warning message text from processing the last data set or external file function.

name: SYSPARM
description: Returns the system parameter string.

name: SYSPROCESSID
description: Returns the process ID of the current process.

name: SYSPROCESSNAME
description: Returns the process name that is associated with a given process ID, or returns the name of the current process.

arguments.name: process_id
arguments.description: specifies a 32–character hexadecimal process ID.

name: SYSPROD
description: Determines whether a product is licensed.

arguments.name: product-name
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression with a value that is the name of a SAS product.

name: SYSRC
description: Returns a system error number.

name: SYSTEM
description: Issues an operating environment command during a SAS session, and returns the system return code.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: specifies any of the following: a system command that is enclosed in quotation marks (explicit character string), an expression whose value is a system command, or the name of a character variable whose value is a system command that is executed.

name: TAN
description: Returns the tangent.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression and is expressed in radians. If the magnitude of argument is so great that mod(argument,pi) is accurate to less than about three decimal places, TAN returns a missing value.

name: TANH
description: Returns the hyperbolic tangent.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: TIME
description: Returns the current time of day as a numeric SAS time value.

name: TIMEPART
description: Extracts a time value from a SAS datetime value.

arguments.name: datetime
arguments.description: is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents a SAS datetime value.

name: TIMEVALUE
description: Returns the equivalent of a reference amount at a base date by using variable interest rates.

syntax.help:
TIMEVALUE (base-date, reference-date, reference-amount, compounding-interval,
	 date-1, rate-1 <, date-2, rate-2,  ..., date-n, rate-n>)

arguments.name: base-date
arguments.description: is a SAS date. The value that is returned is the time value of reference-amount at base-date.

arguments.name: reference-date
arguments.description: is a SAS date. Reference-date is the date of reference-amount.

arguments.name: reference-amount
arguments.description: is numeric. Reference-amount is the amount at reference-date.

arguments.name: compounding-interval
arguments.description: is a SAS interval. Compounding-interval is the compounding interval. An example is month.

arguments.name: date
arguments.description: is a SAS date. Each date is paired with a rate. Date is the time at which rate takes effect.

arguments.name: rate
arguments.description: is a numeric percentage. Each rate is paired with a date. Rate is the interest rate that starts on date.

name: TINV
description: Returns a quantile from the t distribution.

arguments.name: p
arguments.description: is a numeric probability.

arguments.name: df
arguments.description: is a numeric degrees of freedom parameter.

arguments.name: nc
arguments.description: is an optional numeric noncentrality parameter.

name: TNONCT
description: Returns the value of the noncentrality parameter from the Student's t distribution.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: is a numeric random variable.

arguments.name: df
arguments.description: is a numeric degrees of freedom parameter.

arguments.name: prob
arguments.description: is a probability.

name: TODAY
description: Returns the current date as a numeric SAS date value.

name: TRANSLATE
description: Replaces specific characters in a character expression.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that contains the original character string.

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: specifies the characters that you want TRANSLATE to use as substitutes.

arguments.name: from
arguments.description: specifies the characters that you want TRANSLATE to replace.

name: TRANSTRN
description: Replaces or removes all occurrences of a substring in a character string.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that you want to translate.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is searched for in source.

arguments.name: replacement
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that replaces target.

name: TRANTAB
description: Transcodes data by using the specified translation table.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: input data that is transcoded.

arguments.name: trantab_name
arguments.description: translation table.

name: TRANWRD
description: Replaces all occurrences of a substring in a character string.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that you want to translate.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is searched for in source.

arguments.name: replacement
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that replaces target. When the replacement string has a length of zero, TRANWRD uses a single blank instead.

name: TRIGAMMA
description: Returns the value of the trigamma function.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

name: TRIM
description: Removes trailing blanks from a character string and returns one blank if the string is missing.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: TRIMN
description: Removes trailing blanks from character expressions and returns a string with a length of zero if the expression is missing.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

name: TRUNC
description: Truncates a numeric value to a specified number of bytes.

arguments.name: number
arguments.description: specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: specifies an integer.

name: TSLVL
description: provides information about the specifics of the installation, including the release, hot fixes, and maintenance images.

arguments.name: A
arguments.description: additional track information.

arguments.name: B
arguments.description: Script information is in this format:<Script DVD>/script/<Script Name>.bld

arguments.name: C
arguments.description: changes the separator from a comma to a colon; also decodes the image description if the I option is specified.

arguments.name: D
arguments.description: port date (for example, 9.03.01B0D02282010).

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: number of seconds since January 1, 1970 (UNIX date). SAS dates are based on the number of seconds since January 1, 1960.

arguments.name: H
arguments.description: hot fix information.

arguments.name: I
arguments.description: image description. Use with the Z option to decode the field.

arguments.name: M
arguments.description: maintenance release information.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: suppresses error messages if the module is not found.

arguments.name: P
arguments.description: product number.

arguments.name: S
arguments.description: returns a colon-separated list that comprises the Script DVD, Script Name, and Script Location in that order.

arguments.name: T
arguments.description: SAS track information.

arguments.name: Z
arguments.description: decode any fields that are encoded.

name: TYPEOF
description: Returns a value that indicates whether the argument is character or numeric.

arguments.name: C
arguments.description: indicates that the argument is a character value.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: indicates that the argument is a numeric value.

name: TZONEDSTNAME
description: Returns a daylight savings time name.

arguments.name: time-zone-id
arguments.description: specifies a region/area value that is defined by SAS. When you specify a time zone ID, the time zone that SAS uses is determined by the time zone name and daylight savings time rules.

name: TZONEDSTOFF
description: Returns the time zone offset value for the specified daylight savings time.

arguments.name: time-zone-id
arguments.description: specifies a region/area value that is defined by SAS. When you specify a time zone ID, the time zone that SAS uses is determined by the time zone name and daylight savings time rules.

name: TZONEID
description: Returns the current time zone ID.

arguments.name: time-zone-id
arguments.description: specifies a region/area value that is defined by SAS. When you specify a zone ID, the time zone that SAS uses is determined by the time zone name and daylight savings time rules.

name: TZONENAME
description: Returns the current standard or daylight savings time, time zone name.

arguments.name: time-zone-id
arguments.description: specifies a region/area value that is defined by SAS. When you specify a zone ID, the time zone that SAS uses is determined by time zone name and daylight savings time rules.

arguments.name: datetime
arguments.description: specifies a SAS datetime value.

name: TZONEOFF
description: Returns the user time zone offset.

arguments.name: time-zone-id
arguments.description: specifies a region/area value that is defined by SAS. When you specify a time zone ID, the time zone that SAS uses is determined by time zone name and daylight savings time rules.

arguments.name: datetime
arguments.description: specifies a SAS datetime value.

name: TZONES2U
description: Converts a SAS date time value to a UTC date time value.

arguments.name: datetime
arguments.description: specifies a SAS datetime value.

arguments.name: time-zone-id
arguments.description: specifies a region/area value that is defined by SAS. When you specify a time zone ID, the time zone that SAS uses is determined by time zone name and daylight savings time rules.

name: TZONESTTNAME

name: WEEK
description: Returns the week-number value.

arguments.name: sas-date
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data value. If the sas-date argument is not specified, the WEEK function returns the week-number value of the current date.

arguments.name: U
arguments.description: specifies the number-of-the-week within the year. Sunday is considered the first day of the week. The number-of-the-week value is represented as a decimal number in the range 0–53. Week 53 has no special meaning. The value of week('31dec2020'd, 'u') is 52. U is the default value.

arguments.name: V
arguments.description: specifies the number-of-the-week whose value is represented as a decimal number in the range 1–53. Monday is considered the first day of the week and week 1 of the year is the week that includes both January 4 and the first Thursday of the year. If the first Monday of January is the 2nd, 3rd, or 4th, the preceding days are part of the last week of the preceding year.

arguments.name: W
arguments.description: specifies the number-of-the-week within the year. Monday is considered the first day of the week. The number-of-the-week value is represented as a decimal number in the range 0–53. Week 53 has no special meaning. The value of week('31dec2020'd, 'w') is 52.

specifies a 30-day month and a 360-day year in calculating the number of years. Each month is considered to have 30 days, and each year 360 days, regardless of the actual number of days in each month or year.

arguments.description: uses the actual number of days between dates in calculating the number of years. SAS calculates this value as the number of days that fall in 365-day years divided by 365 plus the number of days that fall in 366-day years divided by 366.

name: DQIDENTIFYIDGET
description: Returns an identification analysis score for a given identity from a delimited string of identification analysis scores.

arguments.name: delimited-string
arguments.description: specifies the input value, which must be a delimited string of identification analysis scores. The delimited string is required to have been generated by the identification-analysis-definition. The argument can be specified as a constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a constant or variable.

arguments.name: identity-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the identity, the value of which is returned from the delimited-string. The value of the identity is an identification analysis score. The identity must be supported by the identity-analysis-definition.

arguments.name: identification-analysis-definition
arguments.description: specifies the name of the identification analysis definition that is referenced to generate the return value. The definition must be supported by the locale. The definition must be the same definition that was used to generate the delimited-string.

name: DQMATCH
description: Returns a match code from a character value.

arguments.name: character-value
arguments.description: specifies the input value as a constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a constant or variable.

arguments.name: match-definition
arguments.description: specifies the name of the match definition that is referenced to generate the return value. The definition must be supported by the locale. To determine which match definitions are supported for your locale, see Definitions by Locale.

arguments.name: sensitivity
arguments.description: specifies an integer value that determines the amount of information in the returned match code. Valid values range from 50 to 95. The default value is 85. A higher sensitivity value includes more information in the match code. In general, higher sensitivity values result in a greater number of clusters, with fewer members per cluster.

name: DQSCHEMEAPPLY
description: Applies a scheme and returns a transformed character value.

arguments.name: character-value
arguments.description: specifies a constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to the input value.

arguments.name: scheme
arguments.description: identifies the scheme that is applied to the input value. To apply a SAS format scheme, the scheme argument includes both the path and the file name of the SAS data set, in quotation marks. To apply a QKB-format scheme, the scheme argument is the name of an existing fileref in quotation marks. For all operating environments other than z/OS, the fileref must reference a file specification that includes both the path and the file name that ends in .sch.qkb.

arguments.name: QKB
arguments.description: indicates that the scheme is stored in QKB scheme file format. This is the default value.

arguments.name: NOQKB
arguments.description: indicates that the scheme is stored in SAS format.

arguments.name: PHRASE
arguments.description: compares the entire input character value to the entire length of each of the data values in the scheme. When the value of the scheme-lookup-method is USE_MATCHDEF, the match code values of the entire input value are compared to the match codes of data values in the scheme. A transformation occurs when a match is found between an element in the input value and a data value in the scheme.

arguments.name: ELEMENT
arguments.description: compares each element in the character-value to each of the data values in the scheme. When the value of the scheme-lookup-method is USE_MATCHDEF, the match code of the entire character-value is compared to the match codes of the scheme's data values. A transformation occurs when a match is found between an element in the character-value and a data value in the scheme.

arguments.name: EXACT
arguments.description: (default value) specifies that the character-value is to be compared to the data values in the scheme without changing the character-value in any way. The transformation value in the scheme is written to the output data set only when the character-value exactly matches a data value in the scheme. Any adjacent blank spaces in the input value are replaced with single blank spaces before comparison.

arguments.name: IGNORE_CASE
arguments.description: specifies that capitalization is to be ignored when the character-value is compared to the data values in the scheme. Any adjacent blank spaces in the input value are replaced with single blank spaces before comparison.

arguments.name: USE_MATCHDEF
arguments.description: specifies that the match code of the character-value is to be compared to the match code of the data values in the scheme. A transformation occurs when the match codes are identical.

arguments.name: match-definition
arguments.description: the name of the match definition that is referenced to create the match code for the character-value. The match definition must be supported by the locale. If USE_MATCHDEF is specified, and if a match definition is not stored in the scheme, then a value is required for the match-definition argument.

arguments.name: sensitivity
arguments.description: specifies the amount of information in the match codes that are created during the application of the scheme. With higher sensitivity values, two values must be increasingly similar to create the same match code. At lower sensitivity values, values can receive the same match code despite their dissimilarities.

arguments.name: locale
